title: Service doesn't seem to resume after SSH reboot
body:
<!-- Text between these tags doesn't get displayed so you don't have to remove it -->
## Describe the bug
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
After calling `reboot` from ssh, the service no longer seems to start and the vacuum can no longer be reached via SSH or http.

## To Reproduce
<!--
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error
-->
1. SSH into Vacuum
2. `reboot`
3. Wait for reboot to complete and realize that you can't connect...

### Screenshots
<!--If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.-->

### Vacuum Model
<!-- e.g. Gen2/S5/etc -->
S5

### Valetudo Version
<!-- e.g. 0.5.0 -->
0.6.1

### Firmware Version
<!-- e.g. 2008 -->
2020

### User-Agent
<!-- e.g. Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/75.0.3770.142 Safari/537.36 -->
N/A

## Expected behavior
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
I'd expect the vacuum to come back online, but it appears unresponsive and my only idea is to reapply the firmware...

## Additional context
<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->
- After not being able to connect, I've tried powering the vacuum off and back on, and still nothing.

title: Add support for no-mopping zones on S5 Max and S6
body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7981005/100304522-8fc1a600-2f64-11eb-9ad5-b1b765d34e22.png)


No-mopping zones are like no-go zones, but they are only active when mopping. Very useful for drawing around rugs and carpets. They are available on the S5 Max and the S6, but not the S5. The screenshot above shows how the robot is forced to take an alternate route because of a no-mop zone in the way. 

They can be added in the _Configure forbidden zones_ view of Valetudo. They show up purple to match the stock Mi-Home app. 

I have tested the functionality on my S6 and everything works correctly. I expect it will work fine on the S5 max as well, but I don't have one. 

## Known Issues:

- The button to create a no-mop zone will still appear on the S5. So we will need some way to conditionally display buttons in the _Configure forbidden zones_ page. This is sort of an architectural decision, so I would like to hear suggestions. 

- I wasn't able to find a suitable icon in the provided FontAwesome pack. So I just chose a placeholder for now. [tint-slash](https://fontawesome.com/icons/tint-slash?style=regular) could work nicely.

title: Additional capabilities
body:
Draft, as discussed in #584. Blocks #623.

Caps descriptions in https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/pull/584#issuecomment-727614738, progress below:

- [x] `RawCommandsCapability`
- [x] `CarpetTurboModeControlCapability`
- [x] `LEDControlCapability`
- [x] `ManualControlCapability`
- [x] `SensorCalibrationCapability`
- [x] `SpeakerVolumeControlCapability` (was `VolumeControlCapability`, I renamed it to avoid confusion with volume as in m³)
  - [x] Linux ALSA generic implementation
- [ ] `SystemTimeControlCapability`
  - [ ] Linux generic implementation
- [ ] `DoNotDisturbHoursControlCapability`

Optionally also:

- [ ] `CustomVoicePackManagementCapability`
- [ ] `VoicePackManagementCapability`

title: Xiaomi MiJia 1C (general) Support
body:
Hi all! What a great project! Kudos! 

Im coming from a Roomba with a esp but its finished after years.
Unfortunately i have not so many time because of offspring to find a s5 which is manufactured at the 5th full moon in the year of a bunny or for a s50 max which has to be disassemble to get root. 
so I decide to get a 1c because there is support since the last update. 

my problem is where to start. can someone please write 2-3 sentences for a beginner?

thank you!

title: Please document how to backup/restore map on Viomi STYTJ02YM
body: I have read https://valetudo.cloud/pages/important-files-and-folders.html but my STYTJ02YM doesn't have /mnt/data directory and those filenames are not present on entire filesystem.

title: Update supported-dreame-devices.md
body: Title was incorrectly same as supported Roborock devices.

title: No mopping control in main menu
body:
Hi there,

I am using the newest build of valetudo on a viomi v8. I am missing the mop control in the main menu. I think that in previous builds there was a mopping control, isn‘t it?

title: No menu to enable or select mopping
body:
Hi,

I am not really sure. Currently I've build the actually version of valetudo, but I am missing in the main menu the options for mopping. 

I thought I have seen this in previous versions?

Thanks

title: [Viomi V8] there is no possibility to resume cleaning after pause from Valetudo level
labels: [{'id': 991465605, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw5OTE0NjU2MDU=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/Hypfer/Valetudo/labels/bug', 'name': 'bug', 'color': 'd73a4a', 'default': True, 'description': "Something isn't working"}, {'id': 991465606, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw5OTE0NjU2MDY=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/Hypfer/Valetudo/labels/duplicate', 'name': 'duplicate', 'color': 'cfd3d7', 'default': True, 'description': 'This issue or pull request already exists'}]
body: After pressing 'pause', vacuum is in 'pause' in valetudo. However if I resume it - pressing 'start' in valetudo or on vacuum, it always starts full cleaning.

title: Call command or script by event
body:
I have a suggestion. It would be nice if you could start simple scripts based on events.
e.g. when it starts or is done send a curl command to a SmartHome software without using mqtt.

Is there a way to do that? 

Thank you!

title: Is the "Xiaomi Mi Robot Vacuum Mop Pro" supported?
body:
https://www.amazon.de/dp/B085BPCV7W 

I can't find the model number anywhere, but it looks very similar to the SDJQR02RR, but can do mopping on top of vacuuming. 

I'm just wondering if that model can be rooted, if Valetudo runs on it and if mopping is supported.

title: Update troubleshooting.md
body:
Some more Troubleshooting for Viomi Map Generation
Information mostly from https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/issues/550 and some small things I "found out" during my Problems with the maps.

title: Update faq.md
body: Corrected outdated links to sound packages.

title: handle door becoming a barrier
body:
When I do a room clean with the door closed using a roborock S50 it then updates the map so the door is a permanent obstacle, and afterwards if you ask it to go to a different room it complains that it can't find a route to get there.

Is there a way to mark doors as passable regions, sort of the opposite of a forbidden zone? Or is it possible to prevent a temporary obstacle being marked like a wall?

title: plx merge. #shitoberfest
body: Just for the lulz. plx don't merge .D

title: Send state to MQTT only if it has been changed
body: Valetudo sends state every 60s even it has same values. It's not necessary because messages sent with retain flag.

body:
## Describe the bug In full cleaning or room cleaning mode I can use the map page to follow robot's progress. But in zone cleaning mod the map doesn't update. And on the main page status is in cleaning mode at start but after a couple of seconds display changes to "paused," even though the device is cleaning. I have the global version of the vacuum so I don't have the latest update the Chinese version has. I don't know if this issue is because of this. 3.5.3_0017 is the latest for me. Also, the same happens with python-miio. Vacuum state is in paused like Valetudo. ## To Reproduce Choose any zones made via zones page. ### Vacuum Model STYTJ02YM ### Valetudo Version 0.6.1 - latest git ### Firmware Version 3.5.3_0017 ## Expected behavior It should update robot's position on the map like in other modes.

title: Viomi V7: No map visible - Script not automatically executed
labels: [{'id': 991465605, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw5OTE0NjU2MDU=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/Hypfer/Valetudo/labels/bug', 'name': 'bug', 'color': 'd73a4a', 'default': True, 'description': "Something isn't working"}, {'id': 2229573994, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMjI5NTczOTk0', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/Hypfer/Valetudo/labels/vendor:%20viomi', 'name': 'vendor: viomi', 'color': '1d98b7', 'default': False, 'description': 'Viomi-specific issue'}]
body:
<!-- Text between these tags doesn't get displayed so you don't have to remove it -->
## Describe the bug
<!--

-->
I set up valetudo as described in the docs. 
I am able to control the robot with the web gui

1. In the webgui no maps are displayed. There is only a rectangle stating "No Map Data".
I was not able to find any failed attemps to upload the mapdata in /tmp/

2. I created the script S51valetudo but it is not executed automatically after a reboot. iptables -L -n -t nat stays empty. Only after running it manually, it changes
## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install valetudo
2. Try to open map
4. See error


### Screenshots
<!--If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.-->

### Vacuum Model
<!-- e.g. Gen2/S5/etc -->
Viomi V7

### Valetudo Version
<!-- e.g. 0.5.0 -->
0.6.1

### Firmware Version
<!-- e.g. 2008 -->

### User-Agent
<!-- e.g. Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/75.0.3770.142 Safari/537.36 -->
Chrome

## Expected behavior
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
I want the script to be automatically executed as well as the map to be displayed
[log.txt](https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/files/5271892/log.txt)


I really hope you can help me. I have no clue what else to try.


## Additional context
<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->


Here are a few logs:

title: Roborock S5/S6 Support Now that Root is Available?
body:

title: Forbidden zones/borders aren't displayed on the map
body:
## Describe the bug
Forbidden marks are not displayed

## To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Zones'
2. Click on 'Configure forbidden zones'
3. Set zone or border
4. Click on 'Save'
5. Click on 'Configure forbidden zones' again
6. Result: Empty map without any forbidden zones or borders

Roborock S6

### Valetudo Version
0.6.1

### Firmware Version
1998

### User-Agent
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:80.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/80.0

The map contains forbidden zones and borders :wink:

## Additional context
Forbidden zones and borders are also ignored during cleaning.

title: RFE - disable physical buttons on S5
body:
To start, no idea if this is Valetudo or the Roborock software itself, but giving it a shot

Scenario: 
Sometimes - and with two little kids always in our household - the Roborock S5 is paused by using the physical buttons, while this is wanted. 

Feature request:
A setting to disable the physical buttons. Preferably with a 10 second (hard) press to reboot / shutdown still possible.

title: Backslash "\" is not recognized as char but as escape character in Wifi password
labels: [{'id': 991465606, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw5OTE0NjU2MDY=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/Hypfer/Valetudo/labels/duplicate', 'name': 'duplicate', 'color': 'cfd3d7', 'default': True, 'description': 'This issue or pull request already exists'}]
body:
So, I just tried to update my robot's wifi password and found out that if there occurs a "\\" in the wifi password either the website or something internal treats the \ as an escape character instead of a normal character.

Example:

Wifi password: test\1
Saved password in `/mnt/data/wlan/wpa_supplicant.conf`: test1

In order to fix this, you have to escape the \ character in your password on the website, i.e., enter test\\1 as wifi password.

title: Feature request: Bring back generated maps back
body:
Hi. About a year ago, generated maps were replaced by mqtt maps which contain a textual description of the map and can be used to generate one. 
This being said, while mqtt maps are great for some of the use cases - like live view generated in Home Assistant, there are some cases - for example a notification of last job completed with a map, where a simple png of last job would be perfect, but mqtt map adds a lot of hassle and steps where things can go wrong. It would be great to have both features at the same time.

title: Fix map coloring
body:
This resolves #566 by changing the segment identification.
Previously, the vertices in the internal graph were indexed by generating a sequence, starting at zero. This PR uses the original segment ID from the attached meta data instead, resulting in correct color resolution when given this ID.
When coloring the graph, the algorithm now sorts the vertices by their number of adjacent vertices in descending order. This is not perfect though and does not *guarantee* that the result will only contain four colors from a mathematical standpoint. However, for all my test cases, this approach did use only four colors.

Additionally, I added a fifth color to the map drawer. Any edge case that is still not resolved by this fix should then fall back to this fifth color.

title: Web UI map coloring is broken
body:
<!-- Text between these tags doesn't get displayed so you don't have to remove it -->
## The generated map coloring is incorrect if the segment indexes do not start at 0

If the map drawn by the web UI is given segment data in which the segments are not indexed without gaps and starting at 0, the resulting room colors will always be incorrect. Most of the rooms will get assigned the default color, naturally leading to an unreadable map.

## To Reproduce
<!--
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
-->
1. Use any Valetudo version that contains #562 
2. Render any map data with segment indexes not starting at 0 and optionally having gaps in between.

### Screenshots
<!--If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.-->
--

### Valetudo Version
<!-- e.g. 0.5.0 -->
Any version containing #562 

### User-Agent
<!-- e.g. Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/75.0.3770.142 Safari/537.36 -->
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:78.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/78.0

## Expected behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The map coloring should be able to transparently map segment indexes in a way that produces a coloring scheme, that is only depending on the actual segment content, ignoring any index or identifier of the segment in the calculation.

title: WiFi disconnects after enabling MQTT with default settings
body:
<!-- Text between these tags doesn't get displayed so you don't have to remove it -->
## Describe the bug
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
Opening the MQTT settings, enabling MQTT, not changing any other configuration value and saving that, the robot started disconnecting from WiFi in 20s intervals (with 1-3s inbetween while it reconnected).

The web interface would eventually load but by the time I tried to open any dialog or save any settings it was already not responding to requests anymore or the WiFi connection was completely gone again.

## To Reproduce
<!--
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error
-->
1. Open web interface
2. Go to Settings
3. Go to MQTT
4. Check "Enabled" checkbox [X] 
5. Set Server to "foobar.example"
6. Click "Save MQTT configuration"
7. Wait a few seconds

### Screenshots
<!--If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.-->

### Vacuum Model
<!-- e.g. Gen2/S5/etc -->
S5

### Valetudo Version
<!-- e.g. 0.5.0 -->
Tested on 0.5.2, 0.5.3

### Firmware Version
<!-- e.g. 2008 -->
2020, no reset fix

### User-Agent
<!-- e.g. Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/75.0.3770.142 Safari/537.36 -->
Doesn't matter in this case

## Expected behavior
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
Valetudo should not crash, WiFi should not disconnect.

## Additional context
<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->
Looks like the example mqtt server host is the cause.
/var/log/upstart/valetudo.log:

    [2020-07-19T12:10:44.845Z] [ERROR] MQTT error: Error: getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND foobar2.example
    Segmentation fault (core dumped)

Since disabling via webinterface is quite tricky once it's in the reconnect/disconnect tango, you can use this (replace ip) to send the rest request the second it connects to wifi again:
    
    curl 'http://192.168.178.50/api/mqtt_config' -X 'PUT' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \                                                                                                      
    --data-binary '{"enabled":false,"server":"foobar.example","port":"1883","clientId":"","username":"","password":"","usetls":false,"caPath":"","qos":0,"identifier":"rockrobo","topicPre fix":"valetudo","autoconfPrefix":"","provideMapData":false}'

title: docs: update information about supported roborock devices
body:
model=viomi.vacuum.v8  (STYTJ02YM - Mi Robot Vacuum-Mop P / Production Date: 01/2020)

To get this working on a V8 I simply replaced the text v7 with v8 in the following files before compiling. Using tcpdump I also noticed that my box was trying to connect to de.ot.io.mi.com, so I needed to add this to the local host file.

./lib/miio/Model.js:            "persistent_data": this.identifier !== "rockrobo.vacuum.v1" && this.identifier !== "viomi.vacuum.v7"
./lib/Valetudo.js:    "viomi.vacuum.v7": Viomi,
./lib/devices/Viomi.js: * Implements the viomi.vacuum.v7 device.


/etc/hosts
110.43.0.83 de.ot.io.mi.com ot.io.mi.com ott.io.mi.com


tested on original firmware Ver: 3.5.3_0014

title: Core Data Structure Rework
body:
In the last few days, I tried to rework the whole internal state and map handling.

This is still WIP.

## Still To-Do
- [x] Update Roborock Methods to support new data format (e.g. zoned-cleanup, go-to, etc)
- [x] Fully update map rendering for new Format
- [x] Mop-related state + fan speeds
- [x] Re-introduce UI Button State
- [x] Port Viomi to new structure
- [x] Update Tests
- [ ] Publish final specs for other projects (e.g. lovelace card)
- [x] Various ToDos in the new Code

Maybe:

- [x] Update ICantBelieveItsNotValetudo
- [x] Write Docs on new core Concepts
- [ ] Create status diff or rework diff-usage
- [ ] Use the same entity classes in the UI
- [ ] Fully update client map to not assume roborock-specific coordinates/constants
- [x] Fix approximated robot angle
- [ ] Move current cleanup statistics somewhere else

## New Concepts
There's a new `SerializableEntities` class which shall be used for data that might be serialized.
By using it, one can simply call JSON.stringify on an instance and receive something that could be deserialized later.

Example: 
```
  {
    "__class": "BatteryAttribute",
    "metaData": {},
    "level": 100
  }
```

### Map
There's the ValetudoMap class now. See Comment + JSDoc:
https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/blob/4eab2d3a782194ff689420e71ab7a27849368370/lib/entities/map/ValetudoMap.js#L3-L22

As hinted with the TODO, it should also contain logic such as calucation which layer intersects with which points etc.

#### MapLayer
See Comment + JSDoc:
https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/blob/4eab2d3a782194ff689420e71ab7a27849368370/lib/entities/map/MapLayer.js#L3-L23

#### MapEntity
See Comment + JSDoc:
https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/blob/4eab2d3a782194ff689420e71ab7a27849368370/lib/entities/map/MapEntity.js#L3-L15

### State
For the Robot's state there's the new RobotState class which has a reference to the latest map including all its map-related state information as well as an array of Attributes.

#### Attribute
Attributes provide a generic representation of possible robot state attributes.
Instead of having fixed field-names in the state schema, it is possible to simply push new nodes to the attributes array.

This allows different feature levels such as for example Mop data which isn't required for non-mop robots. Having some kind of model-based feature-flag system would work fine with this approach and might be the next valetudo extension.

##### StatusAttribute
Regarding attributes, the most relevant one is probably the StatusAttribute which is a generic approach to robot status information.

Inspired by the MQTT interface, these main states should include everything that might come.
https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/blob/4eab2d3a782194ff689420e71ab7a27849368370/lib/entities/state/attributes/StatusAttribute.js#L26-L40

Furthermore, there are flags, which may contain additional information extending the Status Value
https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/blob/4eab2d3a782194ff689420e71ab7a27849368370/lib/entities/state/attributes/StatusAttribute.js#L42-L54

For example there's the `RESUMABLE` flag which indicates that a `PAUSED` state could be unpaused.
Also, different cleaning scenarios don't have to be different states now. Instead there are flags for spot, zoned and section cleaning.

The class also contains logic to determine whether or not we should fast-poll the robots state
https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/blob/4eab2d3a782194ff689420e71ab7a27849368370/lib/entities/state/attributes/StatusAttribute.js#L17-L22


I'd like to encourage everyone to take a look at the current state of this PR and provide feedback on the matter.

### Misc

By using a single array instead of an array of arrays for the roborock map parsing, memory consumption was cut in half in my tests.

title: Building valetudo for viomi fails with pkg@4.4.8 and pgk-fetch@2.6
body:
I tried to build valetudo with ``npm run build_viomi`` as stated in the installation manual. However, npm installed pkg@4.4.8 and pgk-fetch@2.6. I guess these are used for the normal ``npm run build`` command for the non-viomi devices. 


I was able to build valetudo for viomi after downgrading to pkg@4.3.7 and pgk-fetch@2.5.

## Describe the bug
embedded detection seems wrong for viomi and my local host

Logic in Model.js:

            try {
                fs.readFileSync("/etc/os-release");
                this.embedded = true;
            } catch (e) {
                this.embedded = false;
            }

So embedded is true if /etc/os-release is readable. This is the case on my local machine but not on the embedded robot. So the logic should be reversed? i.e.

    this.embedded = !fs.existsSync("/etc/os-release");

### Valetudo Version
HEAD

title: Add Availability topic to let Home Assistant also detect an offline robot
body:
This MR adds a Last Will and Testament mechanism which tells Home Assistant about the current connection status.

The `online` status is only sent once at startup and the MQTT broker will set it to `offline` when the connection to Valetudo was lost.

title: Update the reset map FAQ to include info for Gen1/Gen2 devices
body:
I was following the instructions to enable persistent maps in the FAQ, but the map kept resetting after a full cleanup. I'm using a gen1 device and the info in the FAQ didn't apply to it. I later found out this comment https://github.com/dgiese/dustcloud/issues/211#issuecomment-491733796, which cleared my confusion.

This PR mentions the state for both gen1 and gen2 devices.

title: refactor(ui): create api service
body:
My long term plan is to rewrite the ui with Vue, but this cannot be done in one PR.
So I started with some refactoring:
- created a api service for all api requests
- use requests with async/await
- switching from XMLHttpRequest to fetch
- fixes for problems caused by using modules

title: Replace pkg & Upgrade nodejs version
body:
The project is currently using an old and outdated version of `zeit/pkg` as well as nodejs 10.

This approach was taken to avoid installing the full nodejs runtime on the robot and instead simply having a single binary to scp onto the robot.
Since it's severely outdated and we're also at a point where we have to modify the firmwares a lot to get Valetudo to work, it might be reasonable to drop this and simply install the node runtime in the firmware build process.

Newer nodejs versions are a huge improvement both performance- as well as memory-wise so that's definitely worth the hassle

title: Update roborock install instractions
body:
I'm spend a lot of time installing Valetudo on my Xiaomi Gen 1.
At last I've managed to flash the new software to the robot,
but it turned out that Valetudo is not starting.

After some investigation I have found the source of the problem.
The script builder_vacuum.sh parameter --valetudo-path=
should get not only the binary, but also some files
valetudo.conf, hosts and rc.local

I've asked the author of  builder_vacuum.sh and he said that the
best way is just to pass the whole git repo. But the compiled file
is also needed.

By the way, the script builder_vacuum.sh is already updated to
show errors:
https://github.com/zvldz/vacuum/commit/b27d536448df4b3cff798a9c6ad36f6eb387ae79

title: feat: Upgrade MQTT to 4.0.0
body:
This PR upgrades MQTT to the latest version, which brings two major new features:

- MQTT 5 support
- [SNI](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Server_Name_Indication) for TLS connections

There are no significant API changes that are documented, so this should be backwards-compatible, despite the major version numbers. See [Release notes](https://github.com/mqttjs/MQTT.js/releases)

I am specifically interested in SNI support, as I have Mosquitto behind a load balancer and use SNI for routing.

title: Adds time and area information about current clean to MQTT
body:
I wasn't able to find the current clean time nor cleaning area in the MQTT output, so I added these following the format in the Xiaomi Home Assistant integration (i.e. `cleaning_time` and `cleaned_area` from https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/vacuum.xiaomi_miio/).

Allows showing active cleaning information in HA, such as the following card:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1933511/81622871-c284c200-93b7-11ea-9979-6917da7b1df1.png)

title: Generalize MiioSockets to support both server and client versions
body: This is in preparation of an experimental feature in which Valetudo proxies whitelisted requests/responses to the real xiaomi cloud which is great for development and debugging.

body:
## Describe the bug
After upgrading to the latest valetudo release we are able to configure mqtt from the UI. While this is pretty cool in general, I'm not really sure if it is a good idea to show the connection credentials/password in clear text to everyone who could access the web frontend... Would be good to have the ability to disable web editing of the mqtt part completely and/or split out the connection URL into different fields without displaying the current password (as it is done for the wifi config site).

### Valetudo Version
0.5.1

title: adding a kernel route for dustcloud connection
body:
In certain circumstances or user setups (e.g. if no default route is provided for the robot by the DHCP server) the robot couldn't sucessfully connect to the dustcloud because of an `destination unreachable`-reply of the kernel by trying to connect to dustcloud IP `203.0.113.1`.

This is resulting in the `NO MAP DATA` error and could be solved by adding a kernel route for that IP.
As reference for this solution please check the debugging in https://github.com/rand256/valetudo/issues/139 made by @TheAssassin.

title: build: use github action to build release
No build and deploy instructions
body:
I think it's essential for an open source product to have clear instructions how to build it on your own. Right now, the installation instructions just say that you should download the binary and offer no further details on how to build the binary. 

I guess there are a lot of programmers with client side JS experience but never worked with npm / server side JS. So they have no clue how to get started and this might turn away possible contributors.

Looking at the travis configuration I assume it is something simple like

- npm install
- npm run build
- replace /usr/local/bin/valetudo
- service valetudo restart

but it would be great if these steps are in an official documentation.

And what are the dependencies, do you need a specific node.js version?

Additionally, some debugging tipps for new contributors (log configuration etc.) might help getting new contributors .

title: Possible solution for random firmware resets?
body:
I just wanted to point you to this possible solution for the firmware resets we are all facing from time to time: [https://www.roboter-forum.com/index.php?thread/33043-mein-roborock-s50-hat-sich-gestern-selbst-zur%C3%BCckgeflasht/&postID=565266#post565266](url)

User _niete_ posted in this (German) thread that he found in another forum (no idea where ...) that `fsck` is triggering the resets and that these changes should help:
```
# nano /etc/crontab

0 23    * * *   root    service rrwatchdoge stop
10 23   * * *   root    rm /mnt/data/rockrobo/rrlog/*REL -R
15 23   * * *   root    /root/check_all
0 4     * * *   root    service rrwatchdoge start

# nano /root/check_all

umount /mnt/updbuf
umount /mnt/data
umount /mnt/reserve
umount /mnt/default
fsck -y /dev/mmcblk0p10
fsck -y /dev/mmcblk0p1
fsck -y /dev/mmcblk0p11
fsck -y /dev/mmcblk0p6
mount /dev/mmcblk0p10 /mnt/updbuf
mount /dev/mmcblk0p1 /mnt/data
mount /dev/mmcblk0p11 /mnt/reserve
mount -o ro /dev/mmcblk0p6 /mnt/default

# service cron restart
```

Please excuse that I didn't put this into one of the many reset issues. Didn't know where the best place is so that it doesn't get lost. My parents' v1 is also affected but I'm not able to test if this solution really works due to COVID-19 social distancing. Can anyone of you test this and give his thoughts on this?

body:
Hello,

I just flashed the firmware v11_001782.fullos.pkg to my S5 vacuum.  Looked to be working all fine but after the reboot I couldn't access the vacuum via the browsers IP 192.168.X.X that I used during the flashing process. 

I can't find the vacuum in the router page as well, even after some reboots. It seems like with the flash it dropped the connection and when I directly connect to the vacuum via wifi I try to access it by using the IP-adress 192.168.8.33. I can't find a solution for this problem. Mi Home is also not finding the device which seems obvious to me. 

Anyone suggestions? Factory reset and retry the flashing process?

title: Handling robot states and transitions
body:
Currently, its not possible to stop a robot returning from a zoned cleanup via the UI, because only the stop button is enabled. The firmware however only accepts a pause command and simply drops any stop commands.

The way these conditions are handled atm is frankly quite bad and it will get even worse when there are more robots and more firmware versions which may or may not behave differently.


One possible solution could be to build a proper finite state machine for each robot model and use that to determine stuff like

- What is the current state of the robot
- Which actions are available
- What class of state the robot is in (Idle/Working/Error/etc)

So instead of looking at a state object and comparing values, you'd just ask the machine in which kind of state it is in.
We could possibly add triggers to certain transitions e.g. returning to base -> docked or * -> Error and use those to generate events which could be used in other software but that's another topic I think

Maybe there even are graphical tools for creating finite state machines which also support exporting it to a machine-readable format?


This is of course just one idea I just had 20 minutes ago so let me know what you think.
I could likely be completely overthinking this issue.

@alexkn @rumpeltux and everyone else interested of course

body:
<!-- Text between these tags doesn't get displayed so you don't have to remove it -->
When trying to create or edit multiple zones in zone editor, I'm only able to edit 1 zone, after navigating to another zone I get empty map
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->

## To Reproduce

1. Install Valetudo from commit 5dc6e438afc1361b1955230a854a8c677da01e45 
2. service valetudo stop, delete config.json, service valetudo start
3. open valetudo web page, wait for "no map data" map to be replaced with the actual map
4. go to zones tab
5. create a zone 'zone1', edit, mark a rectangle, save, navigate back
6. create another zone 'zone2', click edit - map disappears, and it's not possible to draw rectangles anymore (screenshot)
7. also when navigating back to map tab, the map disappears

### Screenshots
Entering zone editor for the 2nd zone
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11010693/77200809-9d787f00-6aeb-11ea-8b73-66d5dcd38beb.png)

0.4.0

Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:74.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/74.0
<!-- e.g. Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/75.0.3770.142 Safari/537.36 -->

## Expected behavior
1. after creating zone1, editing it and saving, the zone is saved and one can enter it again and map and zone rectangle is shown
2. once another zone editor is entered, map should be shown and user should be able to edit and save the zone

<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->

title: [Viomi] Dummycloud is (always) spoofing 203.0.113.1
body:
<!-- Text between these tags doesn't get displayed so you don't have to remove it -->
## Describe the bug

Hi,
I'm trying to build Valetudo for the Viomi. It builds an runs okay, but the webserver always throws errors. Digging a little deeper, I found, that Valetudo always spoofs the 203.0.113.1 IP, regardless of what I have in the configs.


## To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. edit your config Files:
`develop/config.json`
```
{
  "spots": [],
  "areas": [],
  "dummycloud": {
      "spoofedIP": "110.43.0.83",
      "bindIP": "127.0.0.1"
  }
}
```
Test if all files where spoofedIP is in are set to the 110.43.0.83 adress:
`grep -r "spoofedIP" | grep -v "\.spoofedIP"`
```
lib/res/default_settings.json:        "spoofedIP": "110.43.0.83",
Binary file valetudo matches
develop/config.json:      "spoofedIP": "110.43.0.83",
develop/local/config.json:        "spoofedIP": "110.43.0.83",
viomi_instructions.md:    "spoofedIP": "110.43.0.83"
```

2. Build your application
`npm run build_viomi`
```
> valetudo@0.4.0 build_viomi /root/build/Valetudo
> pkg --targets node10-alpine-armv6 --no-bytecode --options max-old-space-size=32 --public-packages=prettycron .

> pkg@4.3.7
```
3. Copy it to your Robot
`scp valetudo root@robot:/mnt/UDISK/`
4. See error
`root@TinaLinux:~# /mnt/UDISK/valetudo `
```
[2020-03-17T07:30:02.079Z] [INFO] Loading configuration file: /mnt/data/valetudo/config.json
[…]
[2020-03-17T07:30:02.275Z] [INFO] Dummycloud is spoofing 203.0.113.1:8053 on 127.0.0.1:8053
[2020-03-17T07:30:02.280Z] [INFO] Webserver running on port 80
```


## Expected behavior
Have the config file on the robot set up correctly. When editing
/mnt/data/valetudo/config.json
at least the IP is set correctly. I'm now getting another error (local request 15016 get_status timed out) but I have not yet looked further into it.

## Additional context
Valetudo built with https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/tree/5dc6e438afc1361b1955230a854a8c677da01e45

title: Fix handshake logic
body:
Simplify the handshake loop a bit.

Fix a bug where the new Promise(…) returned another Promise in the constructor.

title: [Viomi] Support robot-provided zones.
body:
For Viomi the Robot itself keeps track of rooms.
Exposing those with the zones interface allows the UI to start cleaning them manually.

They are otherwise filtered from the UI. This should thus be a no-op for Roborock, except that the `// Todo: rename areas to zones in config` comment was addressed and some more type-safety was added.

title: MQTT HA Discovery tweaks
body:
Hi,

From reading https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/issues/337#issuecomment-555672615 and https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/issues/337#issuecomment-560081105, I'd like to ask if it would be possible for Valetudo to:

* Add the option to publish retained discovery messages, so HA's MQTT Discovery will work across reboots
* Add a `unique_id` so HA's entity setup can persist itself.

It's possible only one of the two options are needed, but "why not both" :)

title: Turn of device if not cleaning or charging
body:
Hi, 

I would propose the following improvement:
If the cleaner is not running and not connected to the charger it should turn of after some time. 

Background:
My charger is getting warm even when the cleaner is 100 % loaded which indicates some waste of energy. Therefore, I used an external timer to turn off the charger and turn it on shortly before a scheduled cleaning. 
This worked well with the original xiaomi software: after turning off the power supply, the robot turned off, too. Switching on the charger, made the cleaner to boot. 
With valetudo, however, the robot does not turn off.

title: Different firmware wordings - Confused
body:
The manual under https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/wiki/Installation-Instructions is talking about different versions of firmware.

title: FW disappears when vac. gets disconnected from Wifi?
labels: [{'id': 991465606, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw5OTE0NjU2MDY=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/Hypfer/Valetudo/labels/duplicate', 'name': 'duplicate', 'color': 'cfd3d7', 'default': True, 'description': 'This issue or pull request already exists'}]
body:
Back in December I had an issue where it seemed like the VAC disconnected from my Wifi and I had to reload the FW to get it back - it was somewhat of an ordeal detailed here: https://github.com/dgiese/dustcloud/issues/254

I chalked it up to a random issue or maybe something I did wrong even though the vac. worked flawless for about 2 weeks before that point.  I do remember having a power outage in that date range as well just before it happened.

It has now happened again - but instead of going crazy I just reinstalled the Mi app and let it search for the vac.  it found it and I was able to reconnect to my Wifi,  The vac. showed my full map (had map saving on in your FW) but I wasn't able to access the vac. internal web GUI for Valetudo.

I haven't yet attempted to reinstall the FW maybe hoping that someone here can help me understand why this is happening.

My best guess of the commonalities is that both times there was an extended power outage that caused the Robot to be disconnected from the Wifi AP - when the AP came back (SSID was back online) the internet connection was NOT due to my server/router not coming back up when the AP did.

I think at this point something happens with the FW and it possibly reloads the stock FW, but I cannot be sure.

title: Valetudo JSON Map Format can't handle larger maps
labels: [{'id': 991465605, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw5OTE0NjU2MDU=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/Hypfer/Valetudo/labels/bug', 'name': 'bug', 'color': 'd73a4a', 'default': True, 'description': "Something isn't working"}, {'id': 991465608, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw5OTE0NjU2MDg=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/Hypfer/Valetudo/labels/help%20wanted', 'name': 'help wanted', 'color': '008672', 'default': True, 'description': 'Extra attention is needed'}]
body:
Repeatedly parsing a larger map file inevitably leads to valetudo crashing due to it going out of memory. I've tried mitigating this by rewriting the parser in a non-recursive way in b6c67fcb but that sadly couldn't fix it. It did improve readability though.

While testing the new parser, I however found the underlying issue: Filling an array with thousands of 2-element arrays just isn't feasible at all.
Rewriting that part to use typed Int16 Arrays reduced the memory footprint of the test .js file from 40mb for a single map parsing to a mere 9mb.
Using this new format would of course break everything consuming the map data atm.

Since there should be a new and future-proof valetudo map format soon™, I don't think that breaking everything twice is a good idea, but I also strongly dislike the constant crashes I'm seeing.



For reference, here's a mapfile that breaks the parser if parsed repeatedly using the current parser and `--max-old-space-size=32`
[mapfile.zip](https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/files/4227089/mapfile.zip)

title: [viomi branch] Valetudo shutdowns due to "Unable to reach vacuum"
body:
Using the latest viomi branch, on _some_ launches, valetudo restarts itself after ~1.5h uptime due to a retried message reaching the 10.000 retries limit.

I've observed this behaviour on two seperate S50.

Logs attached:

```
[2020-02-19T02:14:01.581Z] [INFO] Webserver running on port 80
[2020-02-19T02:14:06.704Z] [INFO] Connected successfully to mqtt server
[2020-02-19T02:14:09.584Z] [INFO] Cloud connected
[2020-02-19T03:37:33.152Z] [ERROR] Unable to reach vacuum
```
```
[2020-02-19T08:00:10.458Z] [INFO] Webserver running on port 80
[2020-02-19T08:00:16.592Z] [INFO] Connected successfully to mqtt server
[2020-02-19T08:00:18.452Z] [INFO] Cloud connected
[2020-02-19T09:23:41.852Z] [ERROR] Unable to reach vacuum
```

```
[2020-02-17T21:12:19.945Z] [INFO] Webserver running on port 80
[2020-02-17T21:12:33.358Z] [INFO] Cloud connected
[2020-02-17T22:35:51.252Z] [ERROR] Unable to reach vacuum
```

I've patched the code running on one S50 to report the offending message + current stamp information

```
[2020-02-18T07:21:43.124Z] [INFO] Webserver running on port 80
[2020-02-18T07:21:51.594Z] [INFO] Cloud connected
[2020-02-18T08:45:14.572Z] [ERROR] Unable to reach vacuum {
  "method": "get_status",
  "args": {},
  "options": {
    "retries": 10001
  },
  "stamp": {
    "val": 17,
    "time": 1582010503136
  }
}
```
```
[2020-02-19T02:42:42.004Z] [INFO] Webserver running on port 80
[2020-02-19T02:42:50.116Z] [INFO] Connected successfully to mqtt server
[2020-02-19T02:42:50.394Z] [INFO] Cloud connected
[2020-02-19T04:06:13.585Z] [ERROR] Unable to reach vacuum {
  "method": "get_status",
  "args": {},
  "options": {
    "retries": 10001
  },
  "stamp": {
    "val": 17,
    "time": 1582080162033
  }
}
```

In any case, 10.000 retries seem to be far too many. There's no point in receiving a response an hour later

title: Info pane not loading
body:
<!-- Text between these tags doesn't get displayed so you don't have to remove it -->
## Describe the bug
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
This has been bugging me for some time (where some time is about 1,5 years) and it survived a few updates already: on one of two gen2 roborocks I cannot get the info page to load. The spinner keeps spinning for a very long time (not sure if it ever times out actually).

Everything else works fine and has been in the past. Unfortunately, the valetudo.log does not shown any problems at all and there does not seem to be any CLI switches or env variables to enable more verbose output.

It is not that important but I would like to debug it anyway but have no idea how.
When I compare the two robots I can see the following:
 - both are currently running the same binary, built by myself some months ago based on 9fc8db2 from 2019-11.
 - both have this in their `/etc/OS_VERSION`

    ro.product.device=MI001518_RUBY-S_MP_S2018062700REL_M3.3.0_RELEASE_20180627-124454
    ro.build.display.id=RUBY-S_MP_R16_RELEASE_20180627-124454
    ro.sys.cputype=R16.STM32.A3.G1
    ro.build.version.release=001518
    ro.build.date.utc=1530074694

 - the iptables are equal (including the nat table)
 - the `valetudo/config.json` are very different (the one where it works has only an absolute minimal config) but I assume it's not related(?)
 - the hosts files are equal
 - the only difference that I think might matter is a line in the output of `netstat -4np`. The one that does work has this output:

    tcp        1      0 127.0.0.1:40256         127.0.0.1:80            CLOSE_WAIT  29473/AppProxy 

On the good one this connection (with another src port of course) is `ESTABLISHED`. All other connections seem to be equal-ish.
Any idea what could provoke the half-closed connection? AFAICT this would mean that valetudo has once established a connection with AppProxy but then closed it (while AppProxy has not closed it (yet)).

title: Modernize Infrastructure: Support ES6 / Typescript
body:
imho it would be beneficial for the project to modernize the infrastructure so that new code can be written in typescript or at least ES6.

This has a bunch of benefits like:
* having proper support in IDEs, whose automated error checking can avoid a whole class of bugs
* being able to more easily define interfaces and class hierarchies
* potentially being able to compile the code to a more efficient representation which may alleviate some of the binary-size concerns

Similarly the project should probably adopt a linter. I’m not sure what the state of the art is for either though.

title: RFC: The future of Valetudo 2020+
body:
Moving forward, I guess that it is safe to say that there will be more vacuums at some point.
There's a Viomi one in #420 but that will certainly not be the last one.

This seems to be a good time to emphasize the mission of Valetudo.

### What Valetudo _is_
Valetudo aims to be a generic thing that you can put on your vacuum to remove cloud connetivity, provide a local MQTT Interface and maybe the Web interface as well, although I'm unsure about that. It might make sense to decouple it completely.

Valetudo should completely remove any vendor-specific details such as Map formats, Command formats etc.
Basically you should be able to buy a robot, install Valetudo and it works exactly the same as your existing Valetudo-enabled vacuum even if it is made by another vendor.

### What Valetudo _isn't_ 
Valetudo shall not become a swiss army knife of some sort. That means that everything that can be done elsewhere shall be done elsewhere. (e.g. connectivity to other services such as Telegram)

### How do we get there?
I think that Valetudo requires a major rewrite. The current state is basically just a prototype.

The main ToDos that come to my mind are the following:
#### Capabilities
This should feature some kind of capability system similar to the [supported_features](https://www.home-assistant.io/integrations/vacuum.mqtt/#supported_features) of an mqtt.vacuum in home assistant. Especially with the new room detection features, there's just no point in hacking those into the current codebase.

We'd need to figure out what those might be (preferably future-proof) and how to incorporate limits to it such as the 5-Zone Zoned Cleanup limit of the roborock vacuums which often caused confusion e.g. #421 

#### Map Data Format
There needs to be a proper Valetudo Map format which is future-proof and may contain new capabilities we don't even know yet. It will most likely be some binary blob since the current state using JSON just isn't feasible for larger setups as well as mobile access (#356)

Something like Protobuf could probably be used here.

#### Deployment
Valetudo binaries are _huge_ which worked out okay-ish at first but since vendors have now started trimming down hardware specs of their vacuum, I think it's safe to say that the current state isn't future-proof.

We're also using an old and deprecated version of the `pkg` tool used to package valetudo into a single binary since newer pkg versions require a newer libc. That will also certainly break completely at some point.

### Challenges
As you might have noticed, development of Valetudo slowed down quite a bit. There are multiple reasons for that but for the most part it's the fact that it is [mostly just me who worked on Valetudo](https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/graphs/contributors).

Looking at Heise, private Messages, the comments in #400 and many more things, It became clear that the way I mentioned contributers apparently was misleading. **There is almost no community.**

There only thing there is plenty of are entitled end-users who don't understand FOSS _at all_ and just demand that things shall be done for them because reasons.

This ultimately led me to pretty much abandon the project because it just isn't fun.

There are also still unsolved issues with randomly resetting robots (#206) which constantly leads to a lot of frustration on all sides.

Also also there seem to be some interpersonal conflicts which I don't really understand but am unable to clarify since there's just silence.

### Moving forward
There however is a solution to the mentioned challenges: 

If you are unhappy with Valetudo but unable to contribute something to change that just use the non-fork fork [Valetudo-RE](https://github.com/rand256/valetudo) and get the fuck off my lawn.

I am so done with you people.

### Closing remarks

So anyways these are my plans for Valetudo.
As you may have noticed, this Issue is labeled RFC so feel free to add your thoughts

title: startCleaningZoneByCoords "only" supports up to 5 zones
body:
## Describe the bug
Hi @Hypfer ! 👋
Is there a reason behind startCleaningZoneByCoords "only" supporting up to 5 areas, e.g. does the vacuum stop handling things correctly at some point?
https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/blob/9fc8db27d757b196b3036028468ec5f905d216f8/lib/miio/Vacuum.js#L628

I'm asking because some of my zones consist of multiple areas and when cleaning multiple zones at once via MQTT this limit is reached quite quickly. E.g. my corridor zone consists of 3 areas and when I want to clean it twice in a row (it's possible to have a zone more than once in the array and then it cleans twice, thanks for that, very handy! :smile:) it does not work.

## To Reproduce
Run the MQTT `zoned_cleanup` command with a total of more than 5 areas.

## Expected behavior
If there is a technical limitation, e.g. on the robot, a comment in the code about that might be nice, else maybe let's increase the limit? :slightly_smiling_face:

title: Implement support for the viomi devices
body:
viomi.vacuum.v7 uses a different API than roborock, so this required adding decoupling of Robot-specific things.

Current state of viomi support:

*   Reading basic status properties work, cloud & local connection work. Almost all Robot control functions are still broken, but should be easy to add once this patch lands.
*   Map upload is very experimental, fragile and incomplete.

This includes some refactorings to decouple the actual robot device.

*   A common interface class for Robots, implementation classes for Robots.
    * Includes a status interface, with string status codes instead of Roborock specific ints
*   Implementations share common code: `MiioSocket` is an abstraction for UDP protocol used by both cloud and local connection.

Since this project doesn’t have tests and I don’t have a Roborock, I cannot really regression test this. So I would very much welcome if the community could help with this, potentially fixing any regressions that were inadvertedly added.

Thank you!

title: MQTT should gracefully fallback when robot is unprovisioned
body: ## Describe the bug I hope I’m not missing something obvious here, but I’m not getting the vacuum’s state via MQTT. It is always set to `UNKNOWN STATE CODE`. The vacuum reacts to commands sent via MQTT though. For example, this works: ``` mosquitto_pub -h homeserver -t 'valetudo/rockrobo/command' -m 'locate' ``` But the state reported via MQTT looks like this: ``` { "cleanTime": "38.9", "cleanArea": "2064.2", "cleanCount": 87, "last_run_stats": { "startTime": 1578506467000, "endTime": 1578507542000, "duration": 1075, "area": "18.1", "errorCode": 0, "errorDescription": "No error", "finishedFlag": true }, "mainBrush": "261.0", "sideBrush": "161.0", "filter": "111.0", "sensor": "6.6", "state": "idle", "valetudo_state": { "id": -1, "name": "UNKNOWN STATE CODE" } } ``` (I’ve pretty-printed this to avoid the big horizontal scroll bar here.) ## To Reproduce Just start listening to Valetudo’s MQTT messages: ``` # mosquitto_sub -v -h homeserver -p 1883 -t 'valetudo/#' valetudo/rockrobo/attributes {"cleanTime":"38.9","cleanArea":"2064.2","cleanCount":87,"last_run_stats":{"startTime":1578506467000,"endTime":1578507542000,"duration":1075,"area":"18.1","errorCode":0,"errorDescription":"No error","finishedFlag":true},"mainBrush":"261.0","sideBrush":"161.0","filter":"111.0","sensor":"6.6","state":"idle","valetudo_state":{"id":-1,"name":"UNKNOWN STATE CODE"}} ``` ### Screenshots The status is properly displayed on the web frontend: But not published via MQTT: ### Vacuum Model Gen2 ### Valetudo Version 0.4.0 ## Expected behavior Seeing the status (e.g. “Charging”) in the MQTT output. ## Additional context Log output: ``` # tail -f /var/log/upstart/valetudo.log Dummycloud is spoofing 203.0.113.1:8053 on 127.0.0.1:8053 Webserver running on port 80 Connected successfully to mqtt server Got token from handshake: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx Loading configuration file: /mnt/data/valetudo/config.json Dummycloud is spoofing 203.0.113.1:8053 on 127.0.0.1:8053 Webserver running on port 80 Connected successfully to mqtt server Got token from handshake: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx Connected successfully to mqtt server ``` _(Note that I’ve obfuscated the token.)_ Valetudo config: ``` { "spots": [], "areas": [], "mqtt": { "enabled": true, "identifier": "rockrobo", "topicPrefix": "valetudo", "autoconfPrefix": "homeassistant", "broker_url": "mqtt://homeserver", "mapSettings": { "drawPath": true, "drawCharger": true, "drawRobot": true, "border": 2, "scale": 4 } }, "dummycloud": { "spoofedIP": "203.0.113.1", "bindIP": "127.0.0.1" }, "httpAuth": { "enabled": false, "username": "valetudo", "password": "valetudo" }, "allowSSHKeyUpload": true, "map_upload_host": "http://127.0.0.1" } ```

title: problems with installation on Gen1 & some questions about resetting
body:
after a two-day battle with installation I'm taking my chance to ask the community for hints - & question about resetting the vacuum at the end of my post.

**Hardware:** Xiaomi Vacuum Gen1
**Software:** 3.5.4_00404 (according to MiHome app)

I've created my own firmware image using [Dustbuilder](https://dustbuilder.xvm.mit.edu/) and based the build on ver. 3468 (as recommended). tried to install it in three ways:

1. from my VM VirtualBox Ubuntu installation (I'm on Windows), without resetting WiFi (so using my LAN's assigned IP numbers)
2. from my Ubuntu laptop, without resetting WiFi (as above)
3. from my Ubuntu laptop, with WiFi reset, so with a direct connection laptop<->vacuum.

because I didn't build the image by myself, I skipped the _preparations_ part od the installation wiki and jumped to [Flashing the firmware image](https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/wiki/Installation-Instructions#flashing-the-firmware-image).

all of the above 1-3 ways failed. I consider the 3rd option is "the most reliable/desired", so here's the console output during that try (ofcourse MY_TOKEN was the real working token):

**tried it few times, as root user and as normal user - all with the same result. did I missed something, or I must make a factory reset - not only wifi reset?** and if so - the next question is below.

resetting WiFi (home+power button press) IS NOT resetting/clearing usage & cleaning stats. also history stays intact; **does the factory reset (involving also pin in the reset hole) clear above mentioned?** I mean - I'm a fan of the statistics and numbers, it would be sad for me to lose about two years of mileage and start from scratch ;)

labels: [{'id': 991465607, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw5OTE0NjU2MDc=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/Hypfer/Valetudo/labels/enhancement', 'name': 'enhancement', 'color': 'a2eeef', 'default': True, 'description': 'New feature or request'}, {'id': 991465609, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw5OTE0NjU2MDk=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/Hypfer/Valetudo/labels/good%20first%20issue', 'name': 'good first issue', 'color': '7057ff', 'default': True, 'description': 'Good for newcomers'}]
body: As this is not supported on gen1 devices, you should disable this option instead of returning a 501 error after the forbidden zone is saved (see #346 for details).

title: [Idea, not related to the code] Stickers
body:
I would like to have a sticker which I can put on the robot to show that it runs valetudo.
I think this is important to give credit to the community, to educate visitors who see the robot, and because I also put stickers on my laptops, why not on my floor-top-computer as well.
Regarding the educational aspect: as a person who "does semething with computers" people see the devices which I buy and the software which I'm using and sometimes also ask me what do buy. So I see my self in the position to help out with media competency and data competency.

If they see the robot as is they might think it is a cool thing to buy a robotic vacuum cleaner, while they don't see the implications to there privacy, which data is collected, and where the data is going, in short under which circumstances it is a cool idea.

I don't know if some of you think about the same issues. Maybe somebody has already created a cool sticker. Maybe we can also include this privacy aspect into the sticker.

title: adds proper shutdown on SIGTERM and SIGINT
body:
Shutdown handler on unix signals:
- SIGTERM
- SIGINT

closes all open sockets, clients and shuts down the webserver before valetudo is closed.

Resource cleanup and closing open file descriptors (sockets, files,...) is always a good idea when shutting down an application (sometimes file systems can get corrupt when they could not be unmounted correctly during os shutdown due to  e.g. open file descriptors) . So this change might help with the reset issue but I'm not really sure about that.


Please review especially the listed points, as I'm petty new to the code base and node/javascript in general:
- I think all used calls for closing resources are synchronous calls. If not we/I need to refactor the synchronous shutdown methods to asynchronous methods.
- In some classes files are opened for read/write (e.g. Configuration.js). As far as I understand the docs these calls close the opened files automatically?
- Webserver.js:947: had to add this as a workaround (it seems that the variable 'server' needs to be const as it us used later on in a callback) to get to the webserver instance. Maybe someone has a better idea?

title: DHCP bug
body:
<!-- Text between these tags doesn't get displayed so you don't have to remove it -->
## Describe the bug
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
The original firmware and valetudo seem to have a bug that prevents obtaining an IP if the DHCP server is different from the wifi ap.
My setup: 

Router: OPNSense = DHCP server, 192.168.142.x
WIFI AP1: Ubiquiti AP-AC-Mesh, SSID: magrathea
WIFI AP2 (for testing): AVM 7490, Mode: IPClient, SSID: robo

All WIFI devices do get IPs from the OPNSense DHCP, except my Xiaomi Mi Rockrobo (1st gen).
If I put the 7490 back to router mode with DHCP enabled, the robot will obtain an IP.
I did cross-check against the IP-range being the problem, by setting the 7490 to the range used by the OPNSense (no connection between the two for this test, of course).

I even dug up an old Draytek Vigor 2110n, which has an explicit DHCP-relay option, for confirmation, and it's the exact same here: as soon as the internal DHCP is off and the relay active, the robo can't obtain an IP. Other WIFI devices can.

## To Reproduce
<!--
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error
-->

### Screenshots
<!--If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.-->

### Vacuum Model
<!-- e.g. Gen2/S5/etc -->
Xiamo Mi 1st gen (rockrobo.vacuum.v1), 3468

### Valetudo Version
<!-- e.g. 0.4.0 -->
0.4.0

### User-Agent
<!-- e.g. Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/75.0.3770.142 Safari/537.36 -->
Chrome

## Expected behavior
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
The robo should be able to obtain an IP from any DHCP server, not just from the interface it's connected to. Or we should be able to set a static IP as a workaround.

## Additional context
<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->
I've only recently replaced the 7490 with the OPNSense for WAN routing.
However, the problem did also exist in the old setup: even with the 7490 acting as DHCP server I could not connect my robo via the Unifi AP (while other devices could connect perfectly fine).

My workaround was to use the 7490s builtin WIFI for the robo, which worked just fine until I installed the OPNSense and "degraded" the 7490 to IP Client mode = no more DHCP server on the 7490.

title: Make action sheets scrollable
body:
Fixes the issue MichaelBW ran into and reported on Telegram: https://t.me/c/1357472831/10875

The minimized CSS files still need to be updated though, but I'm not sure how to best do so.

title: [Feature Request] Dark Theme
body: Dark Theme for WebUI. Also with time for turn on/off automatically and with sunrise sunset, or via mqtt command.

title: automatic factory reset
labels: [{'id': 991465606, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw5OTE0NjU2MDY=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/Hypfer/Valetudo/labels/duplicate', 'name': 'duplicate', 'color': 'cfd3d7', 'default': True, 'description': 'This issue or pull request already exists'}]
body:
Hi,
My two Xiaomi vacuum cleaners have returned to factory condition. I had to re-train him and flash it again with the Valetudo firmware.
Why did this happen?

thanks
Daniel

title: Problem with Roborock
body: After some time, the vacuum cleaner stopped opening the web interface and began to speak a different language, after resetting the Wifi settings it is not possible to connect via ssh and through the Web interface, what could be the problem?

title: Problem with persistent map data and zone cleanup. Temporarily closed doors affecting the routing permanently.
body: FW 1886 Valetudo 0.4.0 Roborock S50 After an initial successful setup and first cleaning with all doors open the map was recorded correctly. But after the second and third zone cleanup with some doors closed the routing now treats the now again open doors as walls and can't reach some zones. Similar things happen with temporary obstructions like moving chairs. One possible solution could be an option to mark doors as such or a possibility to save one master map state that is reset after each cleanup. A map editor where obstructions can be deleted in such a master map could also be useful.

title: WebUi not showing, service not listed, but cleaning still works
body:
<!-- Text between these tags doesn't get displayed so you don't have to remove it -->
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
My Gen1 is not showing the webui anymore. Cleaning still works using the hardware buttons but otherwise I can't access it.
Connecting via ssh and starting the service gives me this:
_root@rockrobo:~# service valetudo start
valetudo start/running, process 4632_

However when checking
_root@rockrobo:~# service --status-all_

The valetudo service is not listed.

Also
_root@rockrobo:~# service valetudo stop
stop: Unknown instance:_

I tried reinstalling valetudo using RRCC (roborockcontrolcenter) but the problem remains

**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
The webui should of course be shown

**Screenshots**

**Vacuum Model:** Gen1

**Valetudo Version: ** 0.4.0

title: Feature Request: WPA2 Enterprise WIFI
body:
Hi!

I was successfully connecting my Roborock S5 to my Wifi using a RADIUS server by changing the content of the file /opt/rockrobo/wlan/wifi_start.sh. I've added these lines in wifi_sta_mode:
```
        echo 'network={' >> $WPA_CONF
        echo ' ssid="SSID"' >> $WPA_CONF
        echo ' scan_ssid=1' >> $WPA_CONF
        echo ' key_mgmt=WPA-EAP' >> $WPA_CONF
        echo ' #pairwise=CCMP TKIP' >> $WPA_CONF
        echo ' #group=CCMP TKIP' >> $WPA_CONF
        echo ' eap=TLS' >> $WPA_CONF
        echo ' identity="roborock@whatever.com"' >> $WPA_CONF
        echo ' ca_cert="/root/ca.pem"' >> $WPA_CONF
        echo ' client_cert="/root/Roborock.pem"' >> $WPA_CONF
        echo ' private_key="/root/Roborock.key"' >> $WPA_CONF
        echo ' private_key_passwd="SECRET"' >> $WPA_CONF
        echo ' priority=1' >> $WPA_CONF
        echo ' }' >> $WPA_CONF
```

However I had the big problem this part gets overwritten after some days. Any hints how I can make this change permanent? Of course implementing it in the web interface would be better. The location of the certificates might also be an issue though it looked like the files didn't get deleted from the root and opt folder.

Thanks for helping.

title: Can't login to SSH using root
body:
Xiaomi Roborock v1, running 3468 firmware. 

I had a multitude of issues getting Valetudo working as the installation instructions now seem out of date, but finally got the web service running. It's controllable using the token but not MQTT so I believe I need to turn that on in the config file on the robot. I also can't use the Hassio addon to add the map to Home Assistant. However, I can't access SSH to change the config file as it's rejecting passwords. Is it a device-specific password?

title: mqtt - password with colons fails
body:
i tried for hours yesterday until i realized that mqtt was not working because of a colon in my password.

separate entries for username/password would be nice. but i guess a entry in the wiki would be sufficient.

example:
`"broker_url": "mqtt://username:pass:word@192.168.1.22",`

title: Unable to update information in Settings/App Locale
labels: [{'id': 991465605, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw5OTE0NjU2MDU=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/Hypfer/Valetudo/labels/bug', 'name': 'bug', 'color': 'd73a4a', 'default': True, 'description': "Something isn't working"}, {'id': 991465609, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw5OTE0NjU2MDk=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/Hypfer/Valetudo/labels/good%20first%20issue', 'name': 'good first issue', 'color': '7057ff', 'default': True, 'description': 'Good for newcomers'}]
body:
**Describe the bug** Unable to edit the information shown in `Valetudo Webview`->`Settings`->`App Locale`. **To Reproduce** - Edit `/etc/timezone` to a timezone of your choosing (e.g. `Europe/Oslo`). - Or add the following to `/mnt/data/valetudo/config.json`; ``` "allowSSHKeyUpload": true, "map_upload_host": "http://127.0.0.1", + "timezone": "Europe/Oslo", + "location": "no" } ``` **Expected behavior** `Valetudo Webview`->`Settings`->`App Locale` should reflect these settings instead of continuing to show what's hard-coded as default into the `/usr/local/bin/valetudo` binary. **Screenshots** https://github.com/x10an14/Valetudo/blob/add_screenshot/Screenshot%20from%202019-11-01%2022-52-54.png
/mnt/data/valetudo/config.json ```json { "spots": [], "areas": [ ], "mqtt": { "enabled": false, "identifier": "rockrobo", "topicPrefix": "valetudo", "autoconfPrefix": "homeassistant", "broker_url": "mqtt://user:pass@foobar.example", "provideMapData": true, "caPath": "" }, "dummycloud": { "spoofedIP": "203.0.113.1", "bindIP": "127.0.0.1" }, "httpAuth": { "enabled": true, "username": "valetudo", "password": "" }, "allowSSHKeyUpload": true, "map_upload_host": "http://127.0.0.1", "timezone": "Europe/Oslo", "location": "no" } ```
**Vacuum Model:** Xiaomi Roborock S55 (Gen2?) **Valetudo Version** 0.4.0 **User-Agent** `Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/76.0.3809.100 Safari/537.36` **Additional context** N/A.

title: Unable to start Valetudo binary on roborock S55 (Gen2)
body:
**Describe the bug** Unable to start `valetudo` binary on roborock. It has started/re-started for months since first firmware flash this summer. - Lately it's been getting buggy - which I think this symptom may be due to the root cause. - Yesterday I re-flashed it. - Yesterday Valetudo worked and the robot did as it was supposed to. - Today when I came home from work, I didn't get the website to respond, but I could `ssh` into the roborock. **To Reproduce** I can faithfully reproduce it like this on my roborock; ```bash [2019-10-31 22:14:26] 0 x10an14@x10-desktop:~ -> $ ssh roborock Enter passphrase for key '/home/x10an14/.ssh/id_rsa': Welcome to Ubuntu 14.04.6 LTS (GNU/Linux 3.4.39 armv7l) * Documentation: https://help.ubuntu.com/ Last login: Thu Oct 31 22:11:03 2019 from x10-desktop.x10network root@x10roborock:~# /usr/local/bin/valetudo Pkg: Error reading from file. root@x10roborock:~# ``` **Expected behavior** Valetudo webserver should start. Either by `service valetudo (re)start`, or by just executing the `valetudo` binary on `$PATH` (which in my case - and I guess most/everybody else - is `/usr/lib/local/valetudo`). **Vacuum Model:** Xiaomi Roborock S55 (Gen2 I guess that is). **Valetudo Version:** `0.4.0` **User-Agent** N/A. **Additional context** No clue what that would be at this point. I've run `strace /usr/lib/local/valetudo`. If that's of any help, below is the output of said `strace`.

title: Can I call a clean up of a zone from API?
body:
Hi everyone,

I haven't been able to figure out how to issue a clean up of my saved zones via the API.

What I want to do is make a "switcheroo" multiswitch in HomeKit, with my zones, to easily trigger cleaning.

I >ASSUME< it would look something like this, where I just changed the regular example from switcheroo with /zoneclean/zonename and host with robotip/api
```
{
    "accessory": "Switcheroo",
    "type": "multiswitch",
    "name": "Roborock Zones",
    "host": "http://192.168.X.X/api",   // don't forget to specify a port, if necessary
    "multiswitch": [
       { "name" : "Living Room"     , "path" : "/zoneclean/livingroom" },
       { "name" : "Kitchen"         , "path" : "/zoneclean/kitchen"     },
       { "name" : "Hallway"         , "path" : "/zoneclean/hallway"     }
    ]
}
```
Can anyone help me figure this out?

title: Enhance "No-map" FAQ - question
body:
The faq says:
>Since v0.3.0 Valetudo now use the cloud interface and that requires the robot to be provisioned (wifi configured). Therefore, the map will not be displayed in AP mode! Ensure you added your device to your own wifi network. In AP mode, a map will nevertheless be created, that map can later be displayed once connected to the wifi network.

My question is: why does the bot need to be provisioned? Can you give more details about the reasons behind that? 
Especially what do you mean by "Valetudo now use the cloud interface". Which cloud interface does it use and why does it not work locally on the robot? Is an internet connection also required? The project says following in it's readme so I'm a bit confused:
> Valetudo is a standalone binary which runs on rooted Xiaomi Vacuums and aims to enable the user to operate the robot vacuum **without any Cloud Connection** whatsoever.

Thanks in advance

title: Global vars
body:
Hi, so this would be my idea about global vars. It's not finished, but first wanna ask if this is good approach.

One idea which might be good.
JSON like this:
```
"key": {
  "value": "myvalue",
  "httpOK": true/false
}
```

and then create on server side more dynamic global vars and pass to client side only those which have `httpOk == true`. This way it would be easy to hide some of them from client html.

title: Send MQTT attributes only if they changed
body: Current behavior is to send attributes every 60s even they not changed. It's not necessary as messages sent with retain flag.

title: feat(docker): switch to yarn and latest node lts
body:
Hi there, thanks for your nice project. I am using it every week.

I updated the Dockerfile to the latest `node:lts-alpine` since it was getting a little outdated.

I also switched to yarn for the docker install. You have a `yarn.lock` in the project already, but the Docker build was not using it since it it executed the script with `npm`.

The `--frozen-lockfile` option is also good practice to prevent the Docker build from running different dependencies from what is actually in your `package.json` (https://yarnpkg.com/lang/en/docs/cli/install/#toc-yarn-install-frozen-lockfile)

title: Vacuum woke up without timer and spoke in different language
body:
So I'm not home for a week but my girlfriend reported some quite disconcerting event yesterday. Our Valetudo is configured in English and she always speaks English. We also never use the timer functions because I usually just turn it on when I go for lunch (I work at home).

So apparently yesterday night (around 3:00 UTC) she woke up and spoke in a language my girlfriend could not recognize. She woke up from it and after several minutes, she spoke again. My gf speaks Portuguese, English, Spanish and French and would certainly recognize German, Dutch and any Scandinavian language. So I'm thinking it would have been Chinese.

Our home network is normal, behind a NAT without any ports open. We don't have any MQTT devices turned on, we just use the web interface using the local IP. I'd be surprised if anyone would have been able to enter our network. (I do run a small server with some Bitcoin stuff on it but that's all behind a Tor hidden service, so should really not be reachable.)

So my Q would be if anyone has ever heard of a similar experience. A week or two ago, I updated to the new 0.4.0 software.

title: [HowToFix] reset to original firmware directly after install on Gen1
body:
Hi all,

since I spend yesterday evening trying to install valetudo on my gen1 robot without having any luck, I thought I share the solution to remedy this problem. 

I build the image from scratch, following the installation instructions to the letter. Flash was always successful, I could briefly reach the valetudo web interface and ssh into the robot. But after 2 - 3 minutes, the robot would reboot and neither the web interface nor ssh were responding. 

This morning it dawned on me that I probably should perform a complete factory reset of the robot and not just the wifi. Resetting the gen 1 is done by holding down the "home" button and then pressing the little reset button above. Shortly after the robot will tell you that a reset will be done (at least that's what I assume, since mine is from china and therefore speaking mandarin). 

Another voice prompt later, the factory reset was done and I could successfully flash the new firmware and it still runs. 

As for the reason I can only guess, maybe the filesystem was already too full? That I hadn't checked before. 

Hopefully this helps someone.

title: adding multi floor support
body:
resolves https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/issues/69

adds two buttons to the home panel:
- clicking save map asks for a name, then it copies the map to a backup folder with provided name
- clicking load map lists all the saved maps you created and allows you to restore one

it works the way @hagenuck1 described in the original issue. as follow up to this i hope to get it working without the reboot.

it should also work over MQTT custom commands "load_map" and "save_map" but i haven't tested those.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13629809/64403322-645d4d80-d078-11e9-8ee0-a9782d8d8943.png)

title: Fix #289 Instantly update no-go zones and virtual walls
body:
This PR fixes #289.

The issue was caused because the no-go zones and virtual walls are stored in xiaomis map data. Valetudo caches the map data in the `self.map.parsedData` variable in WebServer.js.
This variable only gets updated when the robot uploads a new map to the dummy cloud.

Valetudo calls the `/api/map/latest` endpoint before opening the editor window to get the latest no-go zones and virtual walls. The information returned by this endpoint might not be up-to-date when the no-go zones where changed after the last map upload.

To fix this we just needed to update the `self.map.parsedData` variable in the `/api/persistent_data` endpoint with the data send by the frontend (used to update no-go zones and virtual walls). This will make sure that the changes are visible even before the robot has uploaded a new map.
