title: Hard map limit/boundary issue
body:
I have a rather weird issue that I've faced in Mi Home and Flolevac apps before rooting and now also in Valetudo, so this might be a limitation within the software itself but I thought I'd post it in case others have had this issue.

I have a long home (10m x 34m) and I have the roborock dock at one end of the house to have it out of the way and in a convenient location. Mapping in all software is generated as a horizontal view as per below. The issue; the map seems to hit a hard limit or boundary before the end of the house in our last bedroom. I've performed full cleans multiple times (had the S55 for around 3 days now) and each time, it hits this limit.

When this limit is reached and the map is generated, I've also attempted a zone clean outside of this boundary but the zone is unable to be dragged past this limit.

Images:

Flolevac - Green indicates dock and the far left is where the limit is hit.
![Screen Shot 2019-08-25 at 07 58 21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3942363/63649815-1fcadb80-c775-11e9-98b3-af917520b03d.png)

Attempting to drag a zone hits this boundary and will not allow it to go further (left).
![Screen Shot 2019-08-25 at 08 02 05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3942363/63649822-2bb69d80-c775-11e9-9ee8-8fe757f7d33c.png)

Mi Home - full clean only cleans less than half of the room, most probably again due to this boundary limit.
![Screen Shot 2019-08-25 at 12 42 39](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3942363/63649825-40933100-c775-11e9-91f7-05ccd5f20740.png)

Valetudo - same issue occurs.
![Screen Shot 2019-08-25 at 20 06 30](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3942363/63649841-691b2b00-c775-11e9-8c33-9932aebcb235.png)

I've tried moving the dock to an adjacent wall in the hopes of having the map generate vertically rather than horizontally but this doesn't seem to occur. I've not yet tried to place the dock more centered in my home due to locations being less than ideal (10m width means I can't have clutter around the living area).

Any suggestions or guidance as to how I can either overcome the boundary limit or approach this would be much appreciated!

I've also raised a ticket with Roborock support but they actually admitted to not having tested the limit of the distance between the robot and the dock before. The hard limitation of not being able to drag a zone area past this seems to imply that there is indeed a distance limit? Is there any way to choose an orientation of the map or perhaps remove this limitation?

Thanks in advance.

title: Cleanup won't resume after low battery
body: Vacuum returns to charger at low battery before cleaning is complete. After reaching 100% charge vacuum never resumes cleaning.

title: No mqtt and map
body:
I followed the guide to flash my gen1 vacuum cleaner. I started by doing a factory reset and installing firmware v11_003468.fullos.pkg. I build the firmware by: 

```
rockrobo/dustcloud/devices/xiaomi.vacuum/firmwarebuilder/imagebuilder.sh \
     --firmware=rockrobo/firmware/v11_003468.fullos.pkg \
     --soundfile=rockrobo/firmware/english.pkg \
     --public-key=/root/.ssh/id_ed25519.pub \
     --valetudo-path=rockrobo/valetudo \
     --disable-firmware-updates \
     --replace-adbd 
```

and flashed it by: 
`mirobo --ip 192.168.8.1 --token secret_token update-firmware output/v11_003468.fullos.pkg
`
This works well and I can access the vacuum via the browser over 192.168.8.1 as expected, I can see the map and I set the wifi to connect it to my own network. The vacuum has IP address 192.168.0.31

Next I edit the Valutedo configuration file to setup mqtt for home assistant according to these instructions: https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/wiki/Home-Assistant-Integration I edited `/mnt/data/valetudo/config.json` to: 
```
{
  "spots": [],
  "areas": [],
  "mqtt": {
    "enabled": false,
    "identifier": "rockrobo",
    "topicPrefix": "valetudo",
    "autoconfPrefix": "homeassistant",
    "broker_url": "mqtt://my_username:my_password@my_broker_IP",
    "provideMapData": true,
    "caPath": ""
  },
  "dummycloud": {
    "spoofedIP": "203.0.113.1",
    "bindIP": "127.0.0.1"
  },
  "httpAuth": {
    "enabled": false,
    "username": "valetudo",
    "password": "valetudo"
  },
  "allowSSHKeyUpload": true,
  "map_upload_host": "http://127.0.0.1"
}


```

I use mqtt explorer to check the messages but nothing seems to come by. I want to integrate the map in hassio by using the addon ICantBelieveItsNotValetudo. I also cannot access the map via `http://192.168.0.31/api/remote/map`, I get `Cannot GET /api/remote/map`. 

Furthermore I have the vacuum control integrated in home assistant via 

```
vacuum:
  - platform: xiaomi_miio
    host: !secret xiaomi_ip
    token: !secret xiaomi_token
```
This integration works but I cannot seem to get the map working nor the MQTT messages. `iptables -L` shows: 

```
Chain INPUT (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         
DROP       udp  --  anywhere             anywhere             udp dpt:6665
DROP       tcp  --  anywhere             anywhere             tcp dpt:6665

Chain FORWARD (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         

Chain OUTPUT (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         
REJECT     all  --  anywhere             ot.io.mi.com         reject-with icmp-port-unreachable
```

Am I missing something here? 
Valetudo version: 0.4.0
Firmware version: 3.3.9
Firmware build: 003468

title: [Feature request] Setting maximum charging level
body:
Hi everyone :)
I think a lot of people don't actually use the whole battery capacity the roborock provides, even when doing the whole flat in maximum mode. It would therefore be really nice to have the ability to set a maximum charging level in order to gain some battery life! Li-Ion batteries live way longer if you don't use the lower and upper 10% charging levels.
There is already a thread in the dustcloud repo: [https://github.com/dgiese/dustcloud/issues/188](url). 
I found a "StopCharging" function in the RoboController. If somebody here knows a way to call this function then that might be a way to add this feature :)

title: probably/maybe stupid question about persistence/creation of maps
body:
Hi there.
First of all, thanks for all the work you are putting into this. I don't mean to be a noob but I just try to understand the "default map creation" behavior of the Gen2 Roborock/Valetudo. Flashing of v11_001768 with Valetudo 0.4 was no problem. SSH access like a charm. Enabled persistent data via web. When the robot starts it starts to create a map, as I expected. But as soon as I run another run the previous (live?) map in Valetudo seems discarded and a new map is drawn from scratch. Is this the default behaviour? I can see no kind of "usermap" gets created in /mnt/data/rockrobo/ but the "last_map" clearly has some activity. For me it looks like he rewrites the last_map on every cleaning run. I expected the drawn map of the robot to be persistent in the gui for visualization reasons. Am I mistaken? I tried to read up on live maps, user maps, persistence and so on but I could really use a "reality check" on this.
edit - again for clarification, the "dummycloud" service functionality has been integrated into valetudo, right? As I can see no dummylcoud service or binary on my roborock but valetudo is listening on 127.0.0.1:8053. And is it of relevance when the /mnt/data/rockrobo/map folder is empty? If you can also point me to relevant logs it would be appreciated. Still not quite sure what I am getting wrong. (Backup and reupload of "last_map" works, the map appears as long as the robot is docked but gets erased/redrawn when starting a new clean job)
Thanks again in advance

title: valetudo: unrecognized service
body:
Hallo ich habe die neue 0.4.0 installiert. Valetudo startet nicht automatisch. So habe ich gelesen:

**Describe the bug**
Unable to start a zone cleaning from Home Assistant. I do not get any error messages, the vacuum just doesn't begin cleaning. I tried submitting a start_cleaning_zone api call using Postman and get back the message "Error: Zones must be array of at most 5 zones." despite only including one zone in the request.

1. Install Valetudo and setup Home Assistant autodiscovery

3. Execute script from Home Assistant

title: Question: Map parsing in MapDTO? / Unterstanding
body:
Not a issue just a question.

I was browsing though the files and trying to understand the working of Valetudo.
So i came to the map & map-parsing parts (so about the  Valetudo/lib/RRMapParser.js and  Valetudo/lib/dtos/MapDTO.js files). 
The question that came up was, shouldn't the map parsing logic reside in the MapDTO? 
As i understand it:
The robo software transports map data via http call to the valetudo software, 
which parses this data an holds it in the MapDTO. 
-> In my mind the Data Transport object should not only hold the data but also the capability to "pack" & "unpack" it  (as packing is not needed only "unpack" as in parse)

Or is there anything wrong with my logic/ am i missing something?

title: make basic auth dynamically switchable on/off
body: currently it's required to restart valetudo process after enabling or disabling basic auth in settings for changes to take effect. this PR fixes the issue making switching that setting really dynamic

title: Made the docker image much smaller
body: Also made it much simpelere and do not clutter it.

title: Timer with Zones
body:
Times should (if possible) be configurable to have one or more currently configured zones attached to them.

Example: 
- Clean zone labeled "Kitchen" every Monday, Wednesday, Saturday at 09:00
- Clean zones labeled "Hallway", "Bathroom" every day at 08:00

If no zone is attached to the timer configration, the current behavior is triggered.

Note: There should be a procedure implemented that assures, if a zone with a label is assigned to a zoned timer, the zoned timer is deleted as well

title: Dockerfile for building Valetudo
body:
As requested in #266, here's a simple Dockerfile which will build Valetudo and drop a binary in the current directory by running the following command: 
`docker run --rm -it -v $(pwd):/host valetudo-compiler bash -c "cp /Valetudo/valetudo /host && chown $(id -u):$(id -g) /host/valetudo"`

title: splits client ui into multiple files
body:
Splits the client ui from one html file into multiple
this should make&merge tracking changes easier

title: Valetudo version check
body:
Adds a button to manually trigger a check for the newest valetudo version (on github).
See  #146

title: simplify map saving
body: Currently in `master` map saving is not working correctly, `set_lab_status` is not enough to enable map persistence and the UI could be confusing to users without knowledge of `mirobo` commands. Following on from https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/pull/247 — this PR simplifies the UI with two buttons: * `Save Current Map` -> Calls raw command `set_lab_status 1` + `save_map`. * `Reset Current Map` -> Calls raw command `reset_map`. Note that calling `reset_map` is enough to disable map saving. Tested extensively on an S55.

title: Fix map with HTTP auth
body:
Dustcloud is uploading map using /api/miio/map_upload_handler. When HTTP
auth is enabled, dustcloud can't upload that map. This patches disable
HTTP auth for requests from localhost.

Closes: #252

title: Feature Request: Report dustbin removed/inserted through mqtt.
labels: [{'id': 991465606, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw5OTE0NjU2MDY=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/Hypfer/Valetudo/labels/duplicate', 'name': 'duplicate', 'color': 'cfd3d7', 'default': True, 'description': 'This issue or pull request already exists'}]
body:
Hi

So the vacuum (at least S50) has the voice saying dustbin removed / inserted and refuse to start unless there is a dustbin.

That got me thinking that we should probably be able to pull that information from the robot?

One use case would be to nag me to empty it, or even make it go to the trashcan wait for me to remove and insert the dustbin and then automagically go back to the dock with no other commands.

I have been looking for somewhere to pull that information but I haven't found it, maybe there are someone more knowledgeable about the inner workings that can implement this?

title: inconsistent zone coordinates
body:
I created some zones for different rooms using the /zone tool, and at first it worked ok and I could send the robot to clean different rooms.  Then at some point the coordinates seem to have changed and it tries to go to the wrong area when instructed to clean a zone.

As an example, I created a zone with coordinates [18240,28764,21029,34077], and now after it stopped working properly I created a new zone for the same room, and it has coordinates [17160,18473,22618,21057].  

At some point the map displayed may have rotated 90 degrees? I don't remember how or when it did this, but I think it was random.  I have it set in lab mode so it preserves the map, and it may have been rebooted once or twice, but I don't think any coordinate changes happened with a reboot.

Is there a way of preserving the maps so the zones can be maintained?  I created the zones by drawing rectangles in the /zone tool and then writing them into the config file or the web interface, which is a bit long to repeat regularly.

Robo: 2nd gen S50
FW: 1820
I think the valetudo version is 0.3.1 but not sure how to check, the binary has md5 9f9ac0bc9d24f59d1daa172ddbb519e4

thanks

title: Implement https support out of Valetudo
body:
I implemented a new config section with ssl settings:
```
 "ssl": {
    "enabled": false,
    "key": "/mnt/data/valetudo/roborock.key",
    "cert": "/mnt/data/valetudo/roborock.crt"
  }
```
and also the function of it. If the ssl toggle is switched to `true`. Valetudo will serve its website via `https://` on port `443`.

The frontend behaves very nice and sends all requests now to the secure frontend, but for some reason the map isn't getting any updates anymore. The "No mapdata" map stays there, even if the robot is moving.
Since I'm out of ideas, I hope someone can help me with the map refresh.

```hass_1  | 2019-06-09 23:47:00 INFO (MainThread) [homeassistant.components.mqtt.discovery] Found new component: vacuum valetudo_rockrobo
hass_1  | Traceback (most recent call last):

hass_1  |   File "/usr/src/app/homeassistant/helpers/config_validation.py", line 675, in __call__

hass_1  | voluptuous.error.MultipleInvalid: value is not allowed @ data['supported_features'][0]
```

The auto configuration works perfectly fine when i'm using valetudo 0.3.1. I guess there is an issue with the mqtt message in "_homeassistant/vacuum/valetudo_rockrobo/config_" which has changed quite a bit. 

Version 0.3.1:
```
{"name":"rockrobo","supported_features":["turn_on","pause","stop","return_home","battery","status","locate","clean_spot","fan_speed","send_command"],"command_topic":"valetudo/rockrobo/command","battery_level_topic":"valetudo/rockrobo/state","battery_level_template":"{{ value_json.battery_level }}","charging_topic":"valetudo/rockrobo/state","charging_template":"{{value_json.charging}}","cleaning_topic":"valetudo/rockrobo/state","cleaning_template":"{{value_json.cleaning}}","docked_topic":"valetudo/rockrobo/state","docked_template":"{{value_json.docked}}","error_topic":"valetudo/rockrobo/state","error_template":"{{value_json.error}}","fan_speed_topic":"valetudo/rockrobo/state","fan_speed_template":"{{ value_json.fan_speed }}","set_fan_speed_topic":"valetudo/rockrobo/set_fan_speed","fan_speed_list":["min","medium","high","max"],"send_command_topic":"valetudo/rockrobo/custom_command","json_attributes_topic":"valetudo/rockrobo/attributes"}
```

Current version from git:
```
{"name":"rockrobo","schema":"state","supported_features":["start","pause","stop","return_home","battery","status","locate","clean_spot","fan_speed","send_command"],"command_topic":"valetudo/rockrobo/command","state_topic":"valetudo/rockrobo/state","set_fan_speed_topic":"valetudo/rockrobo/set_fan_speed","fan_speed_list":["min","medium","high","max","mop"],"send_command_topic":"valetudo/rockrobo/custom_command","json_attributes_topic":"valetudo/rockrobo/attributes"}
```


Some additional information:
- I use home assistant version 0.92.2 running on docker.
- My mqtt broker is mosquitto also running on docker.
- I used the roborock S50

title: valetudo fails on sendMessage() called immediately on cold start
body:
I wrote a small mod of Valetudo and came across this issue.

If you happen to call any function from `/lib/miio/Vacuum.js` that is using `sendMessage` early enough, like, straight in `Valetudo.js`, and this happens right after device was (re-)booted, then something definitely breaks and Valetudo stops responding to any requests which is based on `sendMessage` -  for example, getting state from `/api/current_status` etc. Valetudo process is stuck at ~20% CPU usage in this case, but data from web interface still could be loaded: only `sendMessage`-based `/api/` requests are kept in "pending..." state forever.

This issue however doesn't happen if Valetudo was manually restarted when the device is online for some time. It fails only if one is trying to send messages to the vacuum when it's just booted.

Probably it can't be encountered in current releases or master branch (since no messages are sent until user manually opens the web interface, which requires some time), but I believe it is worth finding and fixing since Valetudo seems just can't recover from this state itself if it managed to get into it somehow.

title: Reboot at 3am. Lack of infos.
body:
Hey there,
I am almost sure that there is a scheduled reboot after 3am (for robots of 1st and 2nd gen.). I have both types of robots and they seem to perform some logging/zipping actions and trigger a reboot between 3:15 and 3:25 in the morning. As my miio2mqtt python app loose connection in the period of time I was asking myself:

*Is there are config to adjust the reboot time or even disable the scheduled reboot?
*Is the watchdog triggering the reboot, or any other provess?
*If the watchdog is the origin of the reboots, is there any sources for the programm?

I did some days googeling around with minor succes... thus, I place my questions here - in hope for some input or resonance. Maybe you have the same questions in mind.

title: Fan Power matches only exact values, other values show undefined in GUI
body:
Fan Power values rely on fixed value steps to match the labels shown in the GUI:
`var fanspeedPresets = {
                    38: "Quiet",
                    60: "Balanced",
                    75: "Turbo",
                    100: "Max",
                    105: "Mop"
                };
`

Since you may use other tools, like miio or [RoboRock Control Center](https://github.com/LazyT/rrcc), that allow other values than the above presets, this will result in "undefined" being shown in the GUI.

This should be corrected, that the fanpower is matched in ranges of the predefined steps.

A nice to have would be an additional "Whisper" preset, which turns the fan (almost) off, this is actually useful for moving the robot around with "GoTo".

title: Install voice packs through valetudo
body:
This pull request adds an option in the sound settings to upload and install voice packs.
These changes implement "Phase 1" of #165.

**I added ~~3~~ 2 new express endpoints:**
- _POST - /api/install_voice_pack_ - To upload the pkg file
- _GET - /api/install_voice_pack_status_ - To get the current voice pack installation status
~~- _GET - /api/download_voice_pack_ - miio wants some URL to download the language pack from. This endpoint will basically just provide the file that was uploaded using the POST endpoint. For the sake of security it is not possible to access this endpoint from remote addresses in production mode.~~

**I also added 2 new functions in Vaccum.js:**
- _installVoicePack(url, md5, callback)_ - To start the voice pack installation
- _getVoicePackInstallationStatus(callback)_ - To get the status of the voice pack installation

Tested on Gen 2.

title: Lovelace map card in HA - INFO
body:
Hello,
Not an issue of Valetudo, but maybe here is someone who knows hot to avoid CORB (and I guess later CORS).
I tried to write lovelace card with map as follows:

```
- type: custom: valetudo-map-card
  robot_address: <IP>
```

I thought that it would be the best as all of the drawing would go to client browser.
But then CORB error occured.
Seems that Express library doesn't allow to change content-type header https://github.com/expressjs/express/issues/3961
According to this - https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/13156 Chrome won't allow to download json if Contenty-type header line doesn't end with *json.

Our content type looks like:
```
Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8
```

Any advice?

title: Zone Cleanup is Vertically Flipped
body:
When using zoned cleanup via MQTT:

/valetudo/rockrobo/custom_command
{
  "command": "zoned_cleanup",
  "zone_ids": [
    "kitchen"
  ]
}

Occasionally the area to be cleaned will be vertically flipped on an axis with the dock. In other words, if there is an area of my house below (on the map) the dock, the zoned cleanup will send the vacuum to an area the same shape and horizontal location as intended, but above the dock instead.

This doesn't seem to happen if I use the Zone selector from within Valetudo and pick the zone. Additionally, I can stop the zoned_cleanup activity and then restart it using MQTT and it will then pick the correct area.

Firmware 3.3.9
Build 001748
Valetudo 0.3.1 (built from latest git repo)
Gen 2 Roborock S5

title: Add a basic HTTP status notifier
body:
There are no means of getting Vacuums status without polling it constantly or setting up MQTT, so I implemented a basic status notifier that `POST`s the status over HTTP to a URL defined in the configuration.

Example entry in `/mnt/data/valetudo.config.json`:

```
"http-status-notifications": {
    "url": "http://192.168.0.116:52199/status"
}
```

I admit this pull request is a little selfish, because I need such functionality for [my own thing](https://github.com/onfoot/homebridge-valetudo-xiaomi-vacuum) - I hate to bother the poor overloaded vacuum with constant status polls, so a push would be nice instead. ;)

It could also be used to send push notifications through e.g. Pushover or execute webhooks in IFTTT. I know Valetudo is all about freeing the Vacuum from the "cloud", but we can make it work in the "clouds" we kind of control. ;)

If you like it, and have any ideas on how to make it more complete, or perhaps more stable and crash resistant, let me know!

title: Limit memory allocation
body:
Process valetudo on robot can sometimes consume a lots of memory (memory
leak?). If this happens, kernel sometimes kill player (instead of valetudo
even with high oom score). So let's limit max memory allocation of valetudo
process to 200 MB, which should be enough. Better is to kill valetudo
than player itself.

title: Fix buttons disable state
body:

in_cleaning. Stop and home buttons are not working, so disable them but
enable pause button, which works.

In "Zone cleaning" state Home button doesn't work, so disable them.

title: Fix race condition in manual control start/stop
body:
Sometimes, just after pressing "Start Manual Control", client sends
stop_manual_control API request. It looks like there is small
race-condition. If you ask for vacuum state just after starting manual
control, robots reports state != 7 (!= manual). Some problem is with
stopping. Robot reports state = 7 for few x00 ms after pressing stop.

This patch changes two things:
* don't send API request to start/stop vacuuming when buttons are not
clicked (information about state is read from robot) - just update UI
* postpone refreshing of vacuum internal state just after clicking
buttons

Tested on firmware Gen2 1768.

title: build(TravisCI): execute npm run build command
body: instead of having another explicit build command

title: feat: add MQTT over TLS (mqtts) support
body:
Added an option to specify the certificate authority (CA) file path to enable mqtts support. One has to copy e.g. the `mosquitto.crt` file from the MQTT broker to the robo. This is working because the mqtt npm package uses Node.js TLS lib which can use a custom CA list: https://nodejs.org/api/tls.html#tls_tls_createsecurecontext_options

Example would be:

`    "caPath": "/mnt/data/valetudo/mosquitto.crt"`

This fixes #126. I've successfully used this setup for some weeks.

title: Mistake in instructions
body:
Hi!
Took me ages to figure out why my vacuum wouldn't flash, as I kept getting "No such command" for update firmware. Turns out there is a typo in the instructions:
`mirobo --ip 192.168.8.1 --token XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX update-firmware image/output/v11_001768.fullos.pkg
`
Should be:
`mirobo --ip 192.168.8.1 --token XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX update_firmware image/output/v11_001768.fullos.pkg
`

For the other Linux newbies out there, it might help to fix this :)

I was surprised to see that the map drawn on the web interface, already convoluted (compared to how the robot usually runs), only partially shows all the twists and turns made by the robot. Notably, it turned at least 7 or 8 times around the obstacle highlighted in red, while the map does not show it. The room is a bedroom, with a central bed (20 cm from the floor, plenty of place for the robot to go under) and a table, so nothing extraordinary.

title: which logfiles to look at? Some rooms are half or not any more cleaned
body:
I regularly upgrade my S50 with latest FW and valetudo, and I've observed that these last 3-4 weeks 3 of my rooms got randomly poorly or not at all cleaned. I'm not speaking of what I see on the web map (I opened another ticker for this: #184) but of the dust which remains in the room. Sometimes, the same room is half cleaned, sometimes the S50 doesn't go at all in it (whereas there is no or few obstacles). I've visually checked the sensors which look fine.

I'd would like to investigate a little by myself but was wondering which logfiles to look at, or which command to run (either while cleaning or in a forensic a posteriori approach). Can anyone help me?

Edit: entry #115 could have seemed similar but it seemed it was rather a web map issue. Here, it's really where the robot hasn't gone physically.

title: Added more Information for MQTT settings in the config.json
map tab js error with basic auth from proxy or web server
body:
When accessing Valetudo outside lan network with a reverse proxy using basic autentication the js map module gets a `HTTP/1.1 401 Authorization Required` code. Possible solution is in this post : 

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44720004/javascript-es6-modules-not-passing-along-htaccess-basic-authentication/48101267#48101267

To solve this issue, You can add `crossorigin` attribute to the script tag:

```
<script type="module" crossorigin src="./js/mymodule.js"></script>
<script type="module">
    import * as mymodule from "./js/mymodule.js";
    mymodule.runme();
</script>
```

This will inform the browser to make "credentialed" request (request which aware of HTTP cookies and HTTP Authentication information).

title: no Mapupdate by using Reverseproxy
body:
when you are using an Apache2 ProxyPass with HTTPS there are no live map update.
I'm using the following config:

<VirtualHost *:80>
  ServerAdmin webmaster@localhost
  DocumentRoot /var/www/

  #HTTP zu HTPPS umschreiben
  RewriteEngine On
  RewriteCond %{HTTPS} off
  RewriteRule (.*) https://%{HTTP_HOST}%{REQUEST_URI} [R=301,L]
</VirtualHost>

  #staubi
  ProxyPass "/staubi" "http://192.168.1.6"
  ProxyPassReverse "/staubi" "http://192.168.1.6"

title: Limit zoned cleaning to 5 zones
body:
Please limit zoned cleaning to 5 zones. It's an official limit that could be seen in the Mi Home app.
If you try to clean more than 5 zones, everything will be messed up until you reboot the vacuum.
Maps are broken, status is stuck at "Charging", no way to stop the cleaning.
Sad limitation but there is no way to hack it :(

title: Add stat for the latest clean in publish attributes
body:
To make the life easier for my homeassistant card I need the get the status of the last clean added into published mqtt attributes.

At the first run, or if no clean's exists we have an empty last_run_stats:
-- snipp mqtt record --
valetudo/shou-lee/attributes {"cleanTime":"103.0","cleanArea":"5974.8","cleanCount":181,"last_run_stats":{},"mainBrush":"196.6","sideBrush":"96.6","filter":"46.6","sensor":"0.0"}

If we have stats it will be added into last_run_stats:
-- snipp mqtt record --
valetudo/shou-lee/attributes {"cleanTime":"103.0","cleanArea":"5974.8","cleanCount":181,"last_run_stats":{"startTime":1554527701000,"endTime":1554529164000,"duration":0,"area":"26.9","errorCode":0,"errorDescription":"No error","finishedFlag":false},"mainBrush":"196.6","sideBrush":"96.6","filter":"46.6","sensor":"0.0"}

title: Compress Websocket Map Updates/Send diff only
body:
Since we're always sending the full map object, we're using a lot of bandwidth to stream the map.

This isn't particularly bad if you're at home but gets worse on mobile. Especially in cases where the user is using mobile data.

A simple standalone application which connects to the MQTT Broker, takes the parsed map data, generates a PNG and publishes it to MQTT.

+ a dockerfile for easy deployment.

title: Logo Design for Valetudo
body:
Hello! I really like this project and I thought I could design a logo for it since it doesn't have one. Here are some variations I made with different shapes of the icon as well as different fonts, you can pick one from these 12 and also let me know if there's anything you'd like me to change.

If you like the idea and the whole look of it, I'll provide you with different color variations so it wont be only black and white, and I'll also send it to you in all formats you may need :) Let me know what you think!

title: Introduce resume zone cleaning feature
body:
There is an ability to pause zoned cleaning using pause button now, but there is no way to continue it after being paused.

This fix allows to use Start web interface button or start_pause MQTT command to continue cleaning.

title: Valetudo terminating when publishing MQTT topic
body:
Hello everyone,

I have been trying to get my Roborock 2nd Generation to work with MQTT. I am trying to implement it into FHEM and was successful to the point, that the Device was created. Unfortunately I was not able to get it to execute any command (like "locate").

I confess I am new to the Topic of MQTT and I'm not sure if I understood everything correctly but as far as I can tell, the vaccum should react to commands I publish to the topic "valetudo/rockrobo/command". And I should be able to get a map by publishing to "valetudo/rockrobo/map". When I try to do this though by using MQTT.fx I get no reaction from the Vacuum.

After investigating syslog it shows me that the process is crashing whenever I publish the command:
```
Apr  2 19:13:04 rockrobo kernel: [ 7611.674973] init: valetudo main process (23881) terminated with status 1
Apr  2 19:13:04 rockrobo kernel: [ 7611.675083] init: valetudo main process ended, respawning

```
Is there a way for me to investigate further?
By now I am not sure if this is my Error or if there could be as Issue in the source.
Please correct me if I made any false assumptions. I'm really lost here.

Thanks
Daniel

title: Persistant Maps, No-Go Zones and Virtual Barriers
body:
This issue shall gather information on persistent maps, how they behave etc.

They require a recent firmware and are enabled either by miio `set_lab_status` with payload `[1]` or via filesystem access: `echo -n "1" > /mnt/data/rockrobo/lab.cfg`

To begin, here are a few questions:
* Is there any reason not to enable them?
* How does one force a rebuild? Is that even possible?
* Any change in behavior?

(node-red is unable to decode the binary buffer in which he subscribes to this topic.)
Has somebody been able to subscribe to this topic and "extract" a valid png?
(perhaps via python-script which subscribes and saves the png to disk?)

Regards,

title: MQTT 0.2.1
body:
using the latest (fixed) v.0.2.1
I think MQTT is a great addition!!

But I am not sure I understood the release notes correct...
I should be going into the robot to edit the `mnt/data/valetudo/config.json` file and add this:
`"mqtt": {
	"enabled": false,
	"identifier": "rockrobo",
	"broker_url": "mqtt://foobar.example"
}`
But why does it say "enabled: false". Is that correct??

And I would need to be able to enter a user and a password, since my mqtt server only allows client with authentication. 

And the last question would be about the map... 
https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/issues/75#issuecomment-451731250 here you said that the API should not be used too much since MQTT should be used. I think MQTT is great, but at least for HomeAssistant (which you linked in the release notes), there is no way to get the map over mqtt...
Also have a look at my other issue about getting the map location to grab the map:
https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/issues/121

title: map location 0.2.1, API calls
body:
using the latest (fixed) v.0.2.1 I cannot get the location of the map png anymore from 
`YOUR.VACUUM.ROBOT.IP/api/remote/map?drawRobot=false&drawCharger=true&scale=5&border=3&doCropping=true&drawPath=true`
I dont know if this had to do with the update, but if I remember correctly it worked before updating to 0.2.1

Now if I enter the above URL in a browser I get this:
`TypeError: Cannot read property 'get' of undefined
    at /snapshot/Valetudo/lib/webserver/WebServer.js:802:32
    at Layer.handle [as handle_request] (/snapshot/Valetudo/node_modules/express/lib/router/layer.js:95:5)
    at next (/snapshot/Valetudo/node_modules/express/lib/router/route.js:137:13)
    at Route.dispatch (/snapshot/Valetudo/node_modules/express/lib/router/route.js:112:3)
    at Layer.handle [as handle_request] (/snapshot/Valetudo/node_modules/express/lib/router/layer.js:95:5)
    at /snapshot/Valetudo/node_modules/express/lib/router/index.js:281:22

    at jsonParser (/snapshot/Valetudo/node_modules/body-parser/lib/types/json.js:110:7)
    at Layer.handle [as handle_request] (/snapshot/Valetudo/node_modules/express/lib/router/layer.js:95:5)`

I would still like to be able to get the map png since I am using this as a generic camera in HomeAssistant.

I have read about the MQTT addition in v.0.2.1 but I am not sure if this can help with the map....
See my other issue about the new mqtt feature here: https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/issues/122

title: Ignore empty map files.
body:
If the last map is empty, we get the message:
No usable map found, start cleaning and try again.

[WebServer.js.patch.txt](https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/files/2965856/WebServer.js.patch.txt)

This patch makes it possible to ignore the empty map and the search for the next map.

title: port to strict mode
body:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Strict_mode

Strict mode has many advantages. It allows for better optimization in the browser runtime, it prevents programming bugs that can be caused by the strange behaviour of `var`, and so on. It should really be considered best practise for modern Javascript applications.

title: Integrate improved /zone map into main UI
body:
This integrates the map from /zone into the main UI
It now also has additional features:
- Allows to add multiple zones for zoned cleanup
- Allows to delete/move/resize these zones

Tapping onto the map sets a gotopoint which can be executed by clicking the gps symbol.
For zoned cleanup press the + button to add a zone move / resize it and press play to start the cleanup.

The drawing logic is still in separate files to allow moving it to a different project later on.

Questions about Idea for a new Feature:
I am trying to decide which robot t buy. 
As i understand, they all only support a single map, so are not comfortably usable for non-connected rooms Like different floors, right? 

Reading here, i wonder if it Would be possible to implement multi rooms by eg:
Let the robot record a map of every area, save it somewhere and add some Interface to swap maps whenever you carry it to the New area? Web UI or maybe even via a Hardware mod, Like a nfc sensor/bt beacon? 

Or, could you simply stitch the different maps together? I guess the robot Would happily just clean the area it can currently reach? 

Not being able to reach the charger base will always be an issue i guess. 
Do they send an SOS if they are unable to dock? 

How unrealistic am i?

title: Map path is wiped out every 15 mins
body:
Hi there,

Firstly - i LOVE this app, so thanks for putting in so much time making it 👍 Secondly, I tried searching through for an existing issue but couldn't find one so apologies if i missed it/them.

Anyway - the _only_ complaint I have is that the map path wipes itself out every ~15 mins or so. I have ours hooked up to homeassistant and have the map png being shown on our 'vacuum page'. 

Our usual clean takes just over an hour to complete and once ~15 mins is hit, any path that it's taken is wiped out and the map starts fresh. Looking at the homeassistant log shows the same:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19260137/51898485-1b1f8e00-2405-11e9-8349-4233450a58d9.png)

Just wondering if this is something easily fixed or whether it's possible to offload the data to be rendered elsewhere (if the vacuum's memory is being filled over that 15 mins). 

Thanks again

title: Manage and display virtual walls
body:
I am creating this issue as a follow-up for #44.
In #44, we discovered that the "new map format" after firmware 1780 on gen2 is still the same ppm file, but just encrypted differently.
For valetudo to keep working correctly, we need to patch rrlogd as in https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/issues/44#issuecomment-446178528 or using @cryptomilk's firmwarebuilder additions https://github.com/dgiese/dustcloud/pull/162.

For this issue, I'd like to specifically focus on the no-go zones and the virtual walls.
I have already posted an explanation about where and how these are stored (see: https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/issues/44#issuecomment-450562996 and https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/issues/44#issuecomment-450565679).

I have pushed a demo on how to display these no-go zones and virtual walls in Valetudo (in the new `/zone` map url).
A few issues:
- The map drawing logic is confusing me. Someone with better knowledge could probably get this done faster than me
- The virtuual zones are centered at (25600, 25600), and not (25500, 25500) as it is often common in map parsing scripts. Is this going to be a problem?

My changes can be found here; https://github.com/JohnRev/Valetudo/tree/PersistData . For now, this will only display the stored no-go zones and walls on the map. We can not manage them from Valetudo just yet, and I am not sure if I will have enough time to implement this myself.

title: Easy way to store and restore Map for Gen1 & Gen2
body:
I'm not sure if anyone has done this before (maybe I didn't look hard enough) but it was pretty easy to store and restore the current map on a rooted Xiaomi robot.  To store, I just copied /mnt/data/rockrobo/* (excluding directories) to a backup folder.  To restore, I copied from the backup folder to /mnt/data/rockrobo, then I kill 'player' process which gets restarted by the watchdog within a minute.  Voila, the robot now starts using the restored map.

I think these two functions can easily be incorporated in Valetudo.  It certainly saves me from re-mapping the house whenever the robot decides to forget the map.  My zoned cleanup coordinates are always spot on because of this.

title: Update filename regex and update README.md with patched rrlogd info
Scan newest folder first
body:
Following my pull request https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo/pull/59, I noticed a new bug arising where an older map would be shown. 
This is because ` folders = folders.sort(); ` sorts the directory names in ascending order. However, the newest folder would be found if sorted by descending order.

I am unsure if the same would be needed for `possibleMapFileNames = possibleMapFileNames.sort();`, so I didn't push this change yet.

title: Hosting Valetudo on a standalone web server
body:
Readme says this tool is supposed to be hosted on a vacuum itself. And also that Valetudo only guaranteed to run properly with certain rooted firmware versions. 

The question is: How hard will it be to make it run on a standalone server, not a vacuum? 

Should I start developing my own Web interface to control it? Or there is a chance this already developed and maintenaned tool can be patched to be used with stock device? Is Valetudo tied with some functionality that only can be reached locally on vacuum?

I totally understand the concerns that led to developing a tool which doesn't need cloud. But rooting device and downgrading firmware to support Valetudo is not what I want.

title: Unreliable Coordinate System
body:
Hi!

First of all: Thanks for providing such a good tool for the Xiaomi vacuum. I like it very much!

One thing I noticed after playing with Valetudo for a few days: The coordinate system seems to be kind of unreliable.
Standing in front of the charging station (looking at it), I had a reproducible movements with -x towards me and +y to my left.
After setting up my zones accordingly (did it in the config.json directly), I had to reboot my vacuum to see them and the coordinate system is completely different, an no matter how many reboots and whatelse, I can't get it back the way it was. Now it is +x towards me, and -y to my left (so rotated by 180°, if I'm not mistaken). I did not move the charging station in the whole process.

Additionally, neither orientation fits the description under "Zoned Cleanup" with x for left and right. ;)

Please let know if I can help in any way to solve this.

Btw., I think it would be most intuitive to place the coordinate system  on the charging station and then standing on it (of course only virtually). I would then place the x-axis with increasing numbers to the right and the y-axis orthogonally to the wall.

Best regards,
Fo

title: Adds first version of zoom-/dragable map
body:
Hi,

thanks for this awesome project!

I just wanted to share the map / zoned cleanup thing I am working on.

Here is what it is so far:
- Only tested with the gridmap of the v1 vacuum
- A few static files inside the **/zone** path (not integrated with the main UI)
- You can select a point with one click or a zone with to clicks
- You can start goto / zoned_cleanup commands with the selected coordinates
- The map can be zoomed by mousewheel / pinch-to-zoom
- The map can be dragged around
- The map is updated every 3s which causes a noticable lag

I think it is far from finished/perfect both from a usability point as well as from a technical point, so maybe it should not be merged quite yet.
However it is already quite useful to me (I am using it regularly) and I would like to discuss how to improve it and how to maybe integrate it with other attempts like @WolfspiritM 's rework of the frontend (I would like to have some module management for the frontend instead of one big file to be honest).

I'm looking forward to the discussion :)

title: Map is flipped

I noticed #46 mentioned the issue but I don't see a resolution to this issue there

title: Fixes for GridMap handling
body:
This PR addresses the issue where people are experiencing randomly flipped / mirrored maps.

The reason seems to be that the GridMap file uses coordinates that need to be flipped/inverted (see the relevant forum posts).

Thus, the default behavior was adapted to flip the GridMap Y coordinates when the file is read.

For the (theoretically possible) cases where flipping should not be performed, a configuration
flag (dontFlipGridMap) is supported.

A few method signatures were also slightly changed, and an additional advanced option (preferGridMap) was added.

Note that this PR introduces a new file (MapFunctions.js), which contains general map functions (e.g. to convert between the various coordinate systems). I think that it can be pretty useful -- for example, I'm currently experimenting with displaying the cleaning zones on the map, and it looks quite promising...)

Anyway, let me know if you have any concerns or questions regarding this PR.

title: Map drawing logic duplicated
body:
Hi, I'm currently looking into some enhancements for the map drawing (I'm having issues like flipped maps, and am looking for a way to fix these).

I noticed that right now, there are essentially two places with code for drawing the map: server-side (e.g. /api/remote/map?returnImage=true) and client-side in client.html. From my understanding, that's mostly for historical reasons because the client-side code was there first.

Anyway, I think it would make sense to remove the client-side logic entirely, replacing it with a call to fetch the image from the device. This would make the code easier to maintain. Plus, the volume of data transferred for the map should drastically decrease as well -- that can be an issue if, like me, you're exposing the robot over the internet using a reverse proxy.

Are there any objections to this? If not, then I'd work on this and would probably provide a PR within the next few weeks.

PS: What is the "new persistent map format" you're mentioning in #44 ? Just curious, if it's something easy I might look into that too (no promises though).

title: Timezones
body:
The roborock firmware uses its own timezone configuration: even if you configured the timezone of the ubuntu system correctly and `date` shows the right time the firmware still uses its own tz.
The timers of the roborock (stored in `/mnt/data/rockrobo/apptimer.cfg`) that are also set by valetudo's timer configuration dialog abide this tz and will happily wake you in the middle of the night (been there, done that).

To fix this you have to set two files in `/mnt/data/rockrobo` correctly.
For example, to set the timezone to `Europe/Vienna` you can execute this via ssh:

    echo 'Europe/Vienna' > /mnt/data/rockrobo/timezone
    ln -sf /usr/share/zoneinfo/Europe/Vienna /mnt/data/rockrobo/localtime

Alternatively, `mirobo` does also the correct thing (although wasting a few bytes):
    mirobo  --ip ... --token ...  timezone Europe/Vienna

It would be very nice to be able to do that within valetudo or at least display the timezone information on the timer page ;)

title: Memory leak in Valetudo?
body:
I discovered a small issue when using Home-Assistant to Poll the Map too often (every 10 seconds to get a sort of Live map). The `/tmp` directory filled and the vacuum locked up. A re-boot fixes the issue obviously.

I had done other things on the vacuum in the past so I might have had less space available than normal.

A quick work-around was to throw this into cron
`*/1 * * * * cd /tmp/maps && ls -t /tmp/maps | tail -n +2 | xargs rm --`

I detest web development, javascript and ruby so I'am a bit out my depth here but I guess things would improve if the canvas (or its contents) are not recreated on every update(?) and left to the GC to clean up but either simply updated or manually destructed.

title: Build automatically using travis-ci
body:
This PR helps automatically building valetudo using Travis-CI.

Building automatically is possible because `pkg` will package a armv7-nodejs-binary with the valetudo-source and its dependencies just fine … as long as we tell it not to pre-compile bytecode. As pre-compiled bytecode in node only adds a minor speed improvement for valetudo in my experience, and has virtually no impact on file-size, this seems reasonable to me.

Now, for all this to work nicely, we need a bit of support from @Hypfer as the repo owner. If i remember right, you’d need to:
* Activat and authorize travis-ci for this repo
* Create a personal access token on github (your profile ⇒ edit profile ⇒ developer settings ⇒ personal access token)
* Encrypt your token using https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/encryption-keys/, or by using the `travis` CLI tool.
* Add your token to `.travis.yml` at `deploy.api_key.secure` (I left a marker there)
* Change the URLs for the badge in `Readme.md`
* Tag a commit in the master branch, and push this commit + its tag

From there on, all tagged commits in master will get built and released by travis. All branches and PRs will get built, but not released — their build-artifacts will not get archived anywhere AFAIK. But at least we’ll know they build ^_^.

You can check my example release created this way here:
https://github.com/Nebukadneza/Valetudo/releases
and it’s builds here:
https://travis-ci.com/Nebukadneza/Valetudo

I really hope this helps everyone here, and helps speeding up the process of releasing binaries for us users out there ….

title: Wrong folder regex pattern in rrlog
body:
Hey,

i found a bug that referrers to line 421 in WebServer.js:
`if(/^([0-9]{6})\.([0-9]{17})_R([0-9]{4})S([0-9]{8})_([0-9]{10})REL$/.test(filename)) {
..
`
The folder structure on my Vacuum Cleaner V1 with latest firmware looks like:
`000068.20180730053838787_1387101066286_2018062200REL`

In my case i changed that line to
`if(/^([0-9]{6})\.([0-9]{17})_([0-9]{13})_([0-9]{10})REL$/.test(filename)) { ...`

This works for me, but that is not a generic solution... Please have a look on it. Thank you

title: FeatureRequest: homebridge-module that makes use of the valetudo-api
body:
Dear all,

I'm not sure if this is the right place for such a discussion, so please excuse me if I'm wrong here.
Unfortunately I'm very bad at programming, so I integrated Valetudo into my homebridge (Homekit) environment in a very bad manner. (but it works ;-) 
I use the homebridge-plugin `cmdAccessory` to fire curl-commands with the API-calls for Valetudo. in my homebridge-config this looks similar to this:

```
 {
"name": "RockroboDock",
"on_cmd": "curl 'http://<rockrobo-ip>/api/drive_home' -XPUT -H 'Origin: http://<rockrobo-ip>' -H 'Host: <rockrobo-ip>' -H 'DNT: 1' -H 'Connection: keep-alive' -H 'Content-Length: 0' -H 'Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate' -H 'Accept-Language: de-de' -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_13_5) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/11.1.1 Safari/605.1.15' -H 'Accept: */*' -H 'Referer: http://<rockrobo-ip>/'",
"off_cmd": "curl 'http://<rockrobo-ip>/api/pause_cleaning' -XPUT -H 'Origin: http://<rockrobo-ip>' -H 'Host: <rockrobo-ip>' -H 'DNT: 1' -H 'Connection: keep-alive' -H 'Content-Length: 0' -H 'Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate' -H 'Accept-Language: de-de' -H 'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_13_5) AppleWebKit/605.1.15 (KHTML, like Gecko) Version/11.1.1 Safari/605.1.15' -H 'Accept: */*' -H 'Referer: <rockrobo-ip>/'",
"polling": true,
"interval": "10",
"state_cmd": "/bin/false",
"manufacturer": "aebgit",
"type": "Switch"
},
```

I wonder if somebody more skilled than me, can use this as inspiration for a homebridge-module that uses the Valetudo web-api. In my eyes this would be a great benefit to the homebridge- and  rockrobo-community, because the current solutions (like `homebridge-xiaomi-mi-robot-vacuum`) that make use of the xiaomi-token are very unreliable.

Bet regards
Andreas

**references:**
https://github.com/Hypfer/Valetudo
https://github.com/nfarina/homebridge
https://www.npmjs.com/package/homebridge-xiaomi-mi-robot-vacuum
https://github.com/YinHangCode/homebridge-mi-robot_vacuum
